name: House at the Foothills of Acropolis
host_about:
Greece You Around…
The name of our vacation rental business that was born a night by the fireplace whilst chatting and playing board games with our friends. 

Me (Nikolas) and my wife (Vaggi), parents of 2 lovely toddlers (as all parents think of their children), take pleasure in travelling, camping, reading books under the hot summer sun, cooking for friends, appreciate good music, and enjoy making small handmade ornaments. 

We will be more than happy to host you and give you tips on your stay in Athens and Lesvos, Greece's 3rd biggest island.

name: Plaka, Modern 1-Bed Apartment on Cathedral Sq. CM1
description:
One bedroom apt with large windows overlooking the Cathedral square. In the heart of Plaka the inner city most desirable address in Athens!
Apt was rented long term until recently, hence many of the reviews are from the time it was rented short term.
neighborhood_overview: Organic shops, wine bars, restaurants and right next to all sites.
host_about:
We at Boutique Athens offer accommodation to travellers who are interested in the cultural and artistic pursuits on offer in our amazing city, Athens.
We own and manage several fully serviced, high quality apartments in the centre of the city.
We are interested in food, art, modern history and what is new and exciting.
We personally meet and greet our guests.
We provide full kitchens for cooking, a wonderful art collection and many books on Modern Greece.

name: Acropolis Blue 4 Bd 4 Ba, all ensuite baths
description:
Looking for something special for your group in Athens? The 4-bed 4-bath Acropolis Blue sleeps up to 12 in real beds and ticks all the right boxes.
Acropolis Blue offers 4 en-suite bedrooms, a fully stocked modern kitchen, outdoor dining on the veranda off the living room plus a fabulous terrace overlooking the Parthenon. This is what dream vacations are made of.

Perfect for multigeneration families, a girls getaway or 4 couples traveling together.
neighborhood_overview:
Wondering what our Athens neighborhood is like & if you can walk to the Acropolis?
You can! It's a 15 - 20 minute walk, through the National Gardens or past Hadrian's Arch.
Stay local for dining and shopping though, our Pagrati neighborhood give you the perfect mix of local tavernas and hip cafes & brunch spots.
We've got three supermarkets, twice weekly farmers markets and too many tasty tavernas and chill cafes to mention here.
host_about:
Who would have thought when I boarded a plane for Greece more than 20 years ago, planning on backpacking through the mountains and then heading north through then Yugoslavia I'd end up making Greece my second home?
But here I am, 20 something years later, with our fabulous biz "Greek Vacation Rentals",  opening up our amazing Acropolis view family & group friendly Athens apartments & our MagicFactoryLofts, spacious art filled homes in Chicago, while planning RealGreece travel itineraries and leading small group food & wine focused tours around my adopted homeland and loving the life that I am lucky enough to be living. Of course I did pick up an equally crazy, workaholic Greek husband along the way, as well as a stray Greek animal or two!

Update: January 2023 .... This year Basil and I celebrate 20 years opening our Greek vacation rentals to guests from around the world. All these years we've been hopping between Basil's home city, Athens and Carole's home city of Chicago.  Time and time again guests in Greece asked us if they can stay in our Chicago home while we're in Athens.... so now you can stay in Chicago in our art filled Magic Factory Lofts. We've got 3 and 4 bedroom homes in the heart of the city with Big Shoulders -  in our hybrid warehouse (which in a previous life housed a bar and a dance hall, followed by a costume and magic card factory and then a photography studio where probably every Butterball turkey advertisement in the 1980s was shot .... the photos, not the turkeys!)

So come stay with us ... and then stay with us again. Whether you'd like to enjoy an ouzo in Athens overlooking the Acropolis the Acropolis View Alpha or 7 bedroom  Acropolis SkyVilla, or a beer and a hot dog in Chicago while staying at  our Magic Factory Lofts  we know that you won't be disappointed. 

All of our places are perfect for 3 generation families, multiple couples (especially in Athens pre or post cruise), or groups of friends on a city break or vacation.

name: Elegant Boutique Apartment Athens Kolonaki
description:
The elegant and beautiful apartment is situated in the heart of Athens in a quiet part of Kolonaki, around the corner of the Benaki Museum. Kolonaki is a very conveniant, central and beautiful area of Athens.
It is very tastefully furnished with some old, nice pieces of furniture, paintings, prints and objects.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in a convenient location, just around the corner from the Museum of Cycladic Art and the German Embassy. It is very close to a 24-hour mini market with all the essentials, fantastic coffee shops, restaurants, and beautiful boutiques.
host_about: I enjoy arts, architecture and travelling to all kinds of nations. As a host my goal is to hand you my apartment in a perfect condition and give you privacy. As I live abroad, my lovely representative will be there to meet you when you arrive and show and explain everything to you. Even though I won't be there physically, I am easy to reach and for the unlikely event that there should be any problem, my team will come to assist you.

name: Flat with courtyard near Acropolis
description:
Unique apartment on the ground floor of a neoclassical villa, centrally located under Filopappou Hill and the Acropolis.
Opening onto a lovely big leafy private courtyard. A green, quite “nest” where you can retire while in the center of the city.
neighborhood_overview:
You’ll be staying in a quiet street in the center of Athens, very close to the Acropolis and Thission area, on the limits between two popular, vibrant and neighborhoods, Koukaki and Petralona.
Two steps away from the apartment there is a pedestrian street with numerous beautiful but low budget coffee shops, restaurants and bars.
On the parallel streets you’ll find supermarkets, grocery shops, butcher, bakeries, fruit and vegetables shops , banks and pharmacies. Every Friday there is a local food market with fresh vegetables and fruits very close to the apartment.
10 minutes walk away , you are in the lively trendy neighborhood of Petralona Further up towards the Acropolis there are plenty gift shops as well as travel and rental cars agencies.
host_about:
Ι am a Greek architect and urban planner, teaching in France, and , as such, travel frequently between Greece and France. In the case of my absence, my mother will be very happy to be your host in Greece. 
As we have traveled abroad many times through nocarz we perfectly understand the needs and desires of a traveler but at the same time, born and bred in Greece, the Greek hospitality is something that we have grown up with.

name: Soho Athene Apartment- Acropolis downhill
description:
Welcome to one of the most beautiful areas of Athens, the neighborhood of Thission! This 50 sqm apartment with its elegant decoration focused on every detail promises a high quality stay.
Free Netflix,WiFi, complementary variety of coffee with Nespresso machine, tea, olive oil, spices and much more!Personalized services one demand- transport services, book-ticket assistance, VIP massage service...

Live your holiday like Athenians,stay with us and fell the differnece!

The SoHoAthine Team
neighborhood_overview:
Located on a south-west side of the Acropolis,just a five minutes from the Ancient Agora and Filopappos Hill, the SoHo Athine is offering you a very pleasant accommodation in the Actual Centre of Old Athens. The view from the Philopappos Hill at sunset overlooking the Acropolis is something spectacular. Our apartment is just a few steps away!

Under the Athens Observatory,surrounded by Thissio buildings of the 1930s and on a walking distance to all major historical monuments, the Ancient Agora, Stoa of Attalos,Tower Winds, Plaka and Monastiraki, the excellent location of our apartment will give a great value to all those who are seeking for green and quiet area but still on a very close distance to restaurants, bars, cafes, open air cinemas, live theatres, art studios, galleries and museums.
host_about: To be successful in your professional life you have got to love what you do,you must become at least good if not excellent at it and you have got to go the extra mile,deliver much more than you promise and much more than is expected of you.That is my life motto.I enjoy the journey as a property owner in every step of it.Everything I do for my guests I do with passion and I do large.

name: The Aesthetic Value
description: The house is in a restored old Athenian mansion with several interesting architectural features and a beautiful courtyard. The almost 100 year-old building maintains a close relation to both old and new elements. The spatial arrangement and the carefully selected artistic decoration provide the guest with the adequate environment, enough to feel like home.
neighborhood_overview:
One of the most quiet and sparsely populated neighbourhoods of Athens city centre with a suburban character, plenty of pretty detached houses, surrounded by Skouze Hill, Kolonos Hill, and Plato's Academy Park.

The neighbourhood maintains a character of pure residence compared to other tourist neighbourhoods of Athens whose character has been altered by the excessive presence of rented lodges at the expense of permanent residents.

name: ATHENS FAMILY APARTMENTS (ARTEMIS)
description: The "Athens Family Apartments"   invites you to experience the wonder of both ancient and modern Athens, while being in close proximity to the best sights this unique city has to offer.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the city centre, close to:
- "Archaeological Museum of Athens" ( 10 mins on foot)
- "Car Museum " (5 mins on foot ) .
- "Omonia" Square 5 mins on foot (or one stop by metro )
- "Syntagma" Square 10 mins on foot (or 3 stops by metro ) .
- The " Acropolis " and the surrounding attractions , and the " New Acropolis Museum " ( 3 stops by metro ) .
- Plaka ( Old city) , Monastiraki ( flea market ) and attractions around 15 mins on foot (or 2 stops by metro )
- The Pedion of Areos ( the largest park in the city ) 8 mins on foot .
Just a few steps from the front door you will find supermarkets - restaurants - cafes - snack bars- beauty salons, full markets, shopping centre and the Famous "PATISION AVE" for shopping-therapy.

name: THE ULTIMATE VIEW
description: This small 16 sq.m. penthouse features a comfortable bedroom with a double bed, from where you have a breathtaking view of the Acropolis. There is a stylish bathroom with large walk-in shower and a huge private terrace.
neighborhood_overview:
You will simply be in the best and most centrally located area of Athens. Syntagma Square, the most central spot in the city, is a 2 minute walk. All the main sights are within walking distance, beginning with the Acropolis and Acropolis museum, Plaka and Monastiraki, the Athens "Museum Mile", Vassilissis Sofias avenue. Ermou street, which is the main shopping artery in Athens is one block away.
You can walk down to Psirri, Agia Irini Square and Gazi, which are Athens' hotspots and the place to go for restaurants, tavernas, bars and cafés.
In Syntagma you will find banks, the central post office, as well as kiosks and pharmacies. You will also find the metro station, the tram station, bus stops and taxis, as well as the X95 bus to the airport. The metro will take you to the airport and to Piraeus. The tram and several bus lines will take you to the beach.
You are ten minutes walk from fashionable Kolonaki, the chic area of Athens, and right next to Plaka and Monastiraki.
host_about: J'adore la vie athénienne!

name: Excellent reviews, flexible checkin near Acropolis
description: Our spacious apt 122m (sleeps 5) located in the building we live in. 100 metres from Monastiraki Metro Station (direct line from-to the Airport). Close to Plaka, Ancient Agora, Acropolis & New Museum. All around bars tavernas antique shops, central food market. Miaouli str. is one of the most vibrant and lively streets in Psyri, full of bars, cafes & tavernas. The area never sleeps and during the summer months Miaouli street is a hive of activity with a carnaval feel, well into the early hours.
neighborhood_overview: Within only 100 meters of Monastiraki Square the area offers everything a tourist would wish; a 5 min walk to Plaka, to the Ancient Agora, to Keramikos and 10 min walk to the Acropolis and the New Museum. Nearby is the Flea Market of Monastiraki, the central food market and the trendy shops in the area of Constitution Square. Miaouli Street and its pedestrian area is full of bars & bar restaurants. Walking through the streets you can find tavernas, cafes, small antique shops & other shops selling books, clothes, byzantine icons and handmade jewelry.

neighborhood_overview:
Apartment's location makes it unbeatable. It's located exactly in the city center, just 10 minutes from the most famous pedestrian road of Athens (Ermou) which starts from Monastiraki metro station and ends at the Syntagma square in front of the parliament! Plaka area is in front of your door. Acropolis, Parthenon, and the Ancient Agora where the heart of old Athens beats is under your feet! This area is for sure the best place to stay when visiting the city for many reasons.
Also, you will be staying 15 min away on foot from a very nice area "Kolonaki", which is said to be the posh area of Athens with many bars and local food stores as well as 20 minutes from "Exarcheia" which is Athens' alternative scene.
host_about:
Hello everybody! 
I am from Athens and i have travelled and lived abroad for several years. I live in this wonderful town as i was born here! 
At the moment i work as an account manager for nocarz in Athens.
I am renting flats and I really love this way because I have the chance to meet people coming from all over the world and sometimes I like to drink a coffee with my guests and talking about our countries and many other subjects. In this way it is like I can travel all around the world staying here in Athens...without moving. 
I am also a traveller and i like to book a last minute flight discovering new countries. 
I like tennis, swimming, music and, of course, football.
As a traveller, who has done fieldwork in many areas in Greece and as a person who has long-term experience in travelling, i can provide useful tips about the city and travelling all over Greece. I really enjoy meeting people and look forward to help my guests making their stay in Athens unforgettable!

neighborhood_overview: The location of the apartment is ideal in the sense that it is so close to the heart of Athens, yet not at such a place where one can be overwhelmed by the presence of too many tourists. The Panathinaikon Stadium (home of the first Modern Olympic Games) and Syntagma square are a mere 15 minute walk away while the Evangelismos train station is within a five minute walk. The apartment is located right behind the National Gallery and very close to the Byzantine Museum, one of Athens' most beautiful cultural spots! Numerous cozy and noteworthy small bars and restaurants have been flourishing in the the greater area in the past couple of years. Lastly, Kolonaki, an Athens by night signature area, is just over two main streets, a 10 minute walk away!

name: Bright central apartment 60m2
description:
This sun-lit apartment 60 m2 is on the 3rd floor of a quiet block of flats and is located at the heart of Athens.
5 minutes walk to metro metaxourghio,
15 minutes (1km) from the historical center.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood
Metaxourgeio is a quiet multicultural neighbourhood downtown. It is surrounded by hotels, restaurants, cafes and many cultural points of interest such as the Agios Konstantinos Church, The National Theatre, The National Archeological Museum, The Omonoia Square, Athinas Commercial street , Kerameikos tombs, Thission ans Psiri Areas and finally Acropolis Area one of the most impressive cultural heritage sites worldwide.

After a long period of abandonment in the late 20th century, the area is acquiring a reputation as an artistic and fashionable neighbourhood due to the opening of many art galleries, museums, and trendy restaurants and cafes.
The heart of the neighbourhood is Avdi Square, which draws residents and visitors with its open space, greenery, periodic festivals and gatherings, and adjacent restaurants, theatres and art galleries.

name: Design Studio in Psirri
description:
Mezzanine studio for two.
The studio is located in the center of the vivid neighborhood of Psirri, in a small road next to the small taverns with live music and the bars!
For sightseeing, it is in 10 min. distance of the Acropolis and it's museum!
neighborhood_overview:
Psirri is a very special neighborhood.
In the beginning of the century, poor families from the aegean islands used to come here for work and built small houses. There is still a community of Naxos' people with small restaurants with live music and their traditional products such as cheese, seafood and goat's meat.
Another community of Psirri were the leather workers, making shoes and leather accessories, so there are still many manufacturers where you can buy or even order your own leather goods. These people worked in big industrial buildings built in Psirri during the '60s and '70s.
And last but most importantly, Psirri is surrounded by archeological sites The Acropolis, the Ancient Agora, the Cemetery of Keramikos. All in 3-10 minutes walk.
So, there is not only one way to describe Psirri. The diversity of it's character is what makes it so special and interesting.
host_about: My name is Claire, I am a conservator of works of art and my partner, Manolis, is a musician. We live in the most vivid and art centered area of Athens, full of street art, cafes and restaurants but still next to classical antiquities of the Acropolis, the Ancient Market and the Keramikos.

name: IV.Hip studio apartment in downtown Athens
description:
Welcome at Hip studio!
It is a clean, cozy, modern studio that can cost up to 4 persons.
It is fully equipped with new furniture and electric appliances. Located next to Karitsi Square, between Panepistimio and Syntagma metro station, on a lively and safe neighborhood with restaurants, shops and bars, it can be the starting point for exploring the city. Its colours are reminding of the Greek islands that is why it feels so relaxing staying here. Be the first ones to discover its serene allure!
neighborhood_overview:
What do you have in mind when you think about Athens? Culture? Nightlife? Shopping? this apartment can be a starting point for all of your city explorations. The most important things to see in Athens are within walking distance: Acropolis and, at its feet, the traditional neighborhood of Plaka, Monastiraki, the National Gardens, Ermou Street shopping area, Kolonaki, The Temple of Olympian Zeus, the Panathenaic Stadium.
The apartment is located 440 meters from the Syntagma metro station and the bus service linking the region to the north, south, east suburbs and Piraeus. Quite near, there are many car rental companies, banks, drug stores, supermarkets, bakeries but also bars and restaurants
host_about: We are a group of people Maria, Katerina, Ilias and John that love the city of Athens and travelling. We had a vision about a 1950s building in the heart of Athens ready to be reborn. The result of the combination of these two forces are this hip and elegant apartments in the center of the city that are currently fully renovated and hosting their visitors since the beginning of July 2016.

name: The Little Studio Koukaki - footsteps of Acropolis
description:
Please read carefully:
Cute 'n cozy, well equipped, renovated studio, only 15/20’ minutes walk to the Acropolis (900meters). Situated in a quiet and charming area of Koukaki, ideal if you enjoy being away from the noisy and touristy spots, yet walking distance to the metro Sygrou Fix (800 meters), Acropolis, Plaka and to a wide selection of vintage coffee shops, bohemian bars and traditional "tavernas"on the pedestrian street of Olympiou.
neighborhood_overview:
KOUKAKI was selected by nocarz as a trendy local gem in Athens and one of the top 16 neighbourhoods to visit in 2016.

Adjacent to The Acropolis, Koukaki sits at the bottom of the Lofos Filopappou and, like all great neighbourhoods in Greece, is home to many ancient treasures.

This section of Athens has greatly benefitted from the creation of two pedestrian-only streets (Drakou and Olympiou) which make it the ideal spot to spend an afternoon of wandering, drinking, and people watching. Immerse yourself in local life and don't forget the ouzo!

Article 24 (Issue A' 198/05.12.2024) of the Greek State: As of January 1st 2025, all short-term properties are subject to the Climate Crisis Resilience Tax (aka Environmental Fee). The guest is obligated to pay upon arrival (card or cash) the following amounts:
APR-MAY-JUN-JUL-AUG-SEP-OCT: €15 per night of stay
NOV-DEC-JAN-FEB-MAR: €4 per night of stay

VILLA OLIVIA offers the ultimate Athenian experience and it is ideally located for travelers who want to relax but also , explore the city and feel its vibe.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood of Gazi ( gas )is synonymous with the most known nightclubs and the most elegant restaurants . It is known as an industrial area that took its name from a local gas factory that used to operate an this district. The gas factory was established in the year 1857 and closed its engines in 1984.Today , this factory is used as a cultural center hosting many concerts and special events throughout the year . One can experience the authentic character and the traditional way of life of the locals who formed an independent community with all the conceivable facilities of that time!The entire area is a typical example of an old town in Athens adorned by the beautiful stone buildings with distinct neoclassical features . The area of Gazi won the hearts of the Athenians with cozy restaurants , trendy cafes , small bars .
host_about: friendly educated Athenian ready to host u & provide u with useful info 4 a pleasant and luxurious stay

name: 5 min from Acropolis, New Apartment, Amazing View
description: It is a brand new apartment in the historical centre of Athens, in the old neighborhood of Plaka. It has an amazing view of the Temple of Zeus and the Hadrian's Arch on the one side and on the other a view of Acropolis and Parthenon. There is a bus stop in front of the apartment and the metro station of Acropolis is 3 minutes walking distance, as well as the museum of Acropolis. It has 2 bedrooms with king size beds, 2 bathrooms, fully equipped kitchen, living room with TV and dining room.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in Plaka, which is the old historical neighborhood of Athens, around the northern and eastern slopes of the Acropolis, with labyrinthine streets and neoclassical architecture. Plaka is built on top of the residential areas of the ancient town of Athens. It is known as the "Neighborhood of the Gods" due to its proximity to the Acropolis and its many archaeological sites. It has also many restaurants where you can taste the traditional greek food, as well as bars, cafes and shops. Very close to Plaka there is a picturesque area called Anafiotika. On the other side, 5 minutes walking distance there is another Athenian neighborhood called Koukaki where you can find many small cafes, bars and bistros. Furthermore, near the apartment there are two mini markets, one grocery store, a pharmacy, pastry shops and meat market, as well as restaurants and shops. An informational leaflet with all exact locations and maps will be provided upon your arrival.
Many Athens
host_about: My name is Tina and I am a mother of two children. i love to renovate and decorate houses, as well as to travel around the world and learn about different cultures. My passion is the sea and the sun and i feel lucky living in this country where the sunny days are plenty. I own a couple of properties in Athens and I am happy to rent them to guests who want to discover our ancient greek civilization.

neighborhood_overview: Koukaki is situated southwest of the centre of Athens. Nevertheless it is very close from here to major attractions such as the Acropolis which is within walking distance. Famous Plaka district is just few bus stops from Koukaki. There is also famous Kallimarmaron Stadium where the First Olympic Games were held in 1896.In the last year or so the neighborhood of Koukaki has become yet another happening area to go to at night or even on a sunny day. Much of the activity centers around two pedestrian streets that connect Veikou Street with Syngrou Avenue. If you walk down Makrianni Street with the Acropolis Museum on your right and the tourist restaurants and cafes on your left and cross Hatzihristou street you can continue on Veikou Street and after about 3 blocks turn left on Drakou Street. The street is more of a park than a street with cafes, restaurants and a bar or two, all with tables and chairs outdoors.

Let us share our hospitality with nocarz guests from all over the world.
HAVE FUN! :)

name: Trendy Urban Escape near the Acropolis
description: Fully renovated penthouse apartment in the heart of Athens.  Very close to all amenities, Koukaki is the quietest, vibrant, safe and nice region in Athens centre, 10 mins walk to Acropolis and Plaka, voted by nocarz as one of the hottest places to book!  The flat is on the 5th floor and can accommodate up to 4 people making it a perfect selection for young and old couples or families.
neighborhood_overview:
Ranked by nocarz as one of the top 10 destinations in the world, Koukaki is a lively and captivating neighborhood in Athens.

The area is brimming with restaurants, bars, and cafes, all of which are within easy walking distance of the flat. You'll also find supermarkets, bakeries, and other essential amenities just steps away.

Located in Athens' historic center, Koukaki offers the chance to explore Greece's iconic landmarks, from the Acropolis Museum to traditional tavernas and local bars. Plus, the neighborhood is one of the safest in Athens, so you can enjoy a leisurely stroll with friends or family.

The area boasts excellent public transport links, including the metro, tram, and buses, providing easy access to the airport, the port, and the city center.

There are various places to visit like the following:

Sites of Interest

name: Cute apartment in the historic center of Athens
description:
Cute 30 m2 appartment in Petralona, under Philopappou Hill, near Acropolis. Short walking distance to all main tourist spots at the historical center of Athens.
Our cozy ground floor apartment is located less than 1 minute away from the green metro line (Petralona Station) and less than 10 minutes away from any important spot in Athens. (Acropolis, Monastiraki, Thiseio, Kerameikos and many more…). It's really easy to come from the airport but also from the port as well!
neighborhood_overview:
Petralona is a calm, safe area in the center of the town and it is situated south of the Acropolis, on the other side of Monastiraki.The apartment is ideally situated in a quiet neighbourhood as well as in the heart of Athens. If you enjoy walking you will find some awesome places to visit like the Acropolis Hill, Acropolis Museum, Plaka,Thiseio,Monastiraki, Philopappou Hill, the Ancient Agora and the Hyphestus Temple.All of them are in a range of 20 minutes or less walking or can be reached easily by metro while you may discover many more places to go.
The entrance of Philopappou hill park is 5mins from the appartment.You can cross the park and reach the rock of Acropolis in 20mins as you exploring also the Theatre Doras Stratou and the The Philopappos Monument which is an ancient Greek mausoleum and monument dedicated to Gaius Julius Antiochus Epiphanes Philopappos (link: http://odysseus.culture.gr/h/2/eh251.jsp?obj_id=892).

In the area you can find the Friday's Flee
host_about: Hello! We are a couple Daphne and George. I am a museologist - conservator of antiquities and works of art and George is a fashion (knitwear) designer. We love our two adorable kids, travelling all around as well as music, art, cinema and good food! Of course my super interests are archaeology and ancient greek art and history... So, visit Greece and discover your own myth!

name: romantic sunny cosy app.tment completely renovated
description: It is a small synny, quiet appartment, on the fourth floor, very quiet neihgborhood, 2' from public buses, 10' from metro station, all leading to the center, 15' to archeological museum of Athens,,, My place is close to public transport, city center, parks and art and culture. You'll love my place: location and people. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
host_about:
It’s MY HOUSE where my mother and father lived for years, so it has the aura of my family (and some pictures of our life). Yes, we have constantly hot water, because we used to have a bath, sometimes, you know, A/C in all the rooms, because my mother hated heavy clothes, cable TV because we were always “citizens of earth” and fire extinguishers simply because I am very precautious. We don’t smoke, besides all our visitors always preferred to smoke in our two magnificent, fully flowered verandas. From all the houses of the family I chose this as my residence, because it is located in the center of Athens,and next to the courts (I’m a lawyer, by the way). More specificly I' m a laywer, "citizen of earth", crazy about trips everywhere, very social, known for my hospitality to my friends. I love pets and children. 
As a family, we belong to the “international greeks”, so the spoken languages are: English, French, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese and Portuguese BRAS. Personally I speak English, French and Italian.

name: Belle epoque antique penthouse w/ landmark pergola
description: This incredibly central yet splendidly-isolated 160m penthouse w/sunny terrace garden is ideal for experiencing core Athens (but also isolation). Instant access to museums, entertainment districts, architectural walks, shopping&open-air cinemas. Unique belle époque aesthetic, Lykavitos views, total silence at night despite being between Exarheia and Omonoia squares. Fibreoptic WiFi. Huge corner terrace w/ trees and leafy pergola. Ideal for academics, journos, couples, flâneurs, creatives.
neighborhood_overview:
Tzortz (George) Street is positioned between bustling Kaningos Square, the shops and public transport of Patision Avenue, and the bars, restaurants, bookshops and vinyl stores of Exarheia Square. It is a 5' walk from major tourist destinations such as the National Archaeological Museum, and walking distance from the neoclassical mansions, gardens and terraces of the Benaki and Numismatic Museums and the separate buildings housing the Islamic and Modern Art collections in Kerameikos and Pireos Street respectively.
In the neighbourhood, you are a 10' walk away from the Athens Central Market where, early in the morning you can prowl for the freshest fish, meat, vegetable and fruit alongside the chefs of Athens' best restaurants, before spiriting your haul back to the apartment's professionally-equipped kitchen to whip up culinary feasts.
There are some 40 cinemas within 2km of the apartment, including historical indoor halls and open-air venues located in gardens for the warm su
host_about: I'm a journalist and filmmaker working mostly in the East Mediterranean, North Africa and West Asia. I'm fluent in Arabic, Persian, Turkish and Greek, and I have a soft spot for the two pumas in Athens' zoological park. Writing about East Mediterranean port cities, their past and present, is my passion, and I particularly love Athens, Istanbul and Tunis. Looking forward to sharing with you my custom-written guides to each of these.

name: Wonderful sunlit apt in the center close to subway
description: My place is a five minute walk to the famous metro station "Megaro", the famous Athens Music Hall, in the center of Athens. Great restaurants and convenience stores nearby. Close to major conference hotels. Lycabettus view + park view.
neighborhood_overview:
Our place is in a neighborhood called 'Ilisia'. It's a wonderful and safe neighborhood both in the center but without noise across from a very nice park called Syngrou Park.

There are several major hotels in the vicinity (Crowne Plaza, Hilton, Best Western, Divani Caravel, etc), great restaurants, bakeries, as well as several convenience stores and small supermarkets.

Check out family tavern "Ta Skalakia" which is literally around the corner.
Restaurant 'Vlassis' is also nice and affordable.
'The Bakers' is a short 6-minute walk away but worth trying out.

Plenty of upscale restaurants near Hilton.

name: Cozy and fully renovated Acropolis apartment!
description: A cozy, fully renovated and fresh 45sqm apartment, situated in the heart of Athens, within walking distance from the old city and the Acropolis. Accessible by all means of transport, it is only 5km away from the coastline!
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in Neos Kosmos area.
Neos Kosmos literally translates into the New World. In modern history, it was inhabited by immigrants arriving from the Middle East who settled in the area and created their “New World”. Walking through the streets you can still see buildings, remnants of that era.
Its history though extends much further back in time though as it hosted one of the third largest gyms of ancient Athens. It was also crossed by the river Ilyssos which is referenced in multiple scriptures dating from the 5th century BC. In ancient times it was considered to be a sacred river, the home of the 7 Muses, and was a favorite visiting place for the ancient philosophers Socrates and Lysias.
Nowadays it is part of the heart of Athens, within walking distance from the old city of Athens, the Acropolis, Plaka and all Athens popular tourist attractions. The house is in the heart of the local market area which consists restaurants, bars, nightclubs, coffee s
host_about:
Hi, my name is Stavros! 
My extensive professional background in the tourism industry helps me make your stay pleasant.
I also share your obvious passion for travel which gives me a unique aspect on how to help organise your experience!

name: 3 min from Syntagma Metro. Unique Style Flat
description: 270 meters from the Greek Parliament, the Syntagma Metro Station and the Athens airport bus station. This is a uniquely designed flat arranged with two double beds or a double and two twin beds. Acropolis Museum is a 10 min walk, while Ermou (the main shopping Athenian street) is just 180 meters away. Nightlife in Plaka, the famous old neighborhood, starts at the street's corner, while there is a variety of greek and ethnic restaurants and small supermarkets up and down the street.
neighborhood_overview: This is the very center of Athens. A three minutes walk will take you to the Greek House of Parliament, situated in Syntagma Square. As expected, public transportation by bus, metro and tram are available and being in the heart of the city center one has extremely easy access to any part of Athens or Piraeus. All major museums can be reached by a short walk while Plaka, the neighbourhood of the old city of Athens is virtually at the corner of the street. There is a multitude of possibilities for eating out, either in traditional greek restaurants or in a big number that cater for ethnic cuisine. Though in the absolute city center, mini markets, fruit shops, bakeries, all that one would expect in a housing district are available in a radius of no more than 200 meters.
host_about: I love travelling, getting to know people and understanding their culture. This is the reason I prefer to fly and drive extensively, in my journeys. Furthermore, I believe that everybody should enjoy wholeheartedly whatever it is she/he is doing, at any time or period of one’s life, or else just walk away from it. My motto is: Think and act, the opportunities are ever present.

name: Dine on the Shaded Balcony in the Heart of the City
description: Experience Athens from a stylish, centrally-located apartment with a shaded balcony, perfect for alfresco dining. This beautifully designed space offers modern comforts, a cozy living area, and a fully equipped kitchen for a convenient stay. Enjoy quick access to historical landmarks, local markets, and vibrant cafes. Ideal for couples or small groups, this apartment combines relaxation with city exploration, ensuring a memorable stay in the heart of Athens. Book now to start your adventure!
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Neos Kosmos, a vibrant and convenient neighborhood in the heart of Athens. This area perfectly balances residential tranquility with urban accessibility, making it ideal for travelers seeking an authentic Athenian experience close to the city's best attractions. Just south of the Acropolis, Neos Kosmos offers easy access to historical landmarks, trendy cafes, and local dining spots that capture the essence of Greek cuisine and culture.

A short walk or metro ride will bring you to iconic sites like the Acropolis Museum, the Parthenon, and Plaka’s charming, winding streets. You’re also minutes from the lively Syntagma Square, where you can catch the ceremonial Changing of the Guard. With Neos Kosmos metro station nearby, connecting to every part of the city is effortless, whether you're venturing to Monastiraki's bustling flea market, shopping in Kolonaki, or exploring Athens’ lively nightlife.

For a local touch, explore the nearby neighborhood markets, a

We treat each guest like a friend, helping them immerse in local culture. We offer 5-star experiences through carefully curated spaces and personalized services. 

Our focus is on quality over luxury, making every stay feel like home.

name: Bright & cozy central flat close to top sights
description: A beautiful, central and spacious apartment at the famous Kallidromiou str, within walking distance from the main sights of Athens ( Monastiraki, Acropolis, Plaka) and just 200m from National Archeological Museum (a must-see), in a lively residential neighborhood with plenty of  supermarkets, grocery stores, bakeries, restaurants and coffee shops.  The property is easily accessible by bus (the stop is at 100m) or Underground (green or red line) (at 700m) (Victoria Station or Omonia).
neighborhood_overview:
The Museum area is a lively, historical residential neighborhood, with some beautiful neoclassical buildings, remnants of the golden era of Athens. Home to many artists and intellectuals, this neighborhood has always had a deep impact on the artistic and political life of Athens. Here you can find plenty of markets, coffee shops, cozy restaurants & tavernas open all day.

Get to see the first ever analogue computer!

One of the must-see landmarks is the National Archeological Museum (at 200m from the property). The National Archaeological Museum of Athens is the largest archaeological museum in Greece and one of the most important museums in the world devoted to ancient Greek, Roman and Egyptian art. Its abundant collections, with more than 11,000 exhibits, provide a panorama of Greek civilization from the beginnings of Prehistory to Late Antiquity. Among the astonishing exhibits is the Antikythera mechanism, the first ever analog computer used to predict with acur

name: Artist's spacious loft downtown
description:
In a small street, between four hotels ,is situated my apartment. It was an office building totally used now as residence from the new owners (except the ground floor).
It's a spacious loft 100m2.
An open plan area with seating area,dinning table and a fully equipped kitchen. Separated,on the back side,is the bedroom and the bathroom.
Everything in the loft,spaces ,furniture,lighting lamps and objects are designed by me and they are part of my personal collection. I m designer-lighting artist .
neighborhood_overview:
Psirri,Monastiraki and Plaka,are the oldest neighborhoods in Athens. For many years, Psirri, had lost its residential character and had become the center of craftsmanship in Athens, mostly about leather,clothing, bronze and lighting lamps.
Last years,this character changed. Many new residents (mostly artists) chose to stay here and many industrial buildings were converted into residential or hotels.
Now,walking in the small streets you will see a lot of the old activities together with stylish bars,restaurants and tavernas,cafes, vintage clothes shops, fashion hair salons, antique sale shops.
Psirri is the area of the city center were Athenians prefer to meet for a coffee or for lunch-dinner during weekend or after a shopping at Ermou str.(the most commercial street in Athens).

neighborhood_overview:
Enjoy a wonderful stay at the classic neighborhood of Athens and meet the best sides of the city!
The neighborhood is quiet with friendly residents and classic, art deco buildings, artistic cafes, bars and family owned tavernas serving home cooked food, tiny stores with design clothes and accessories or locally produced delicacies. Right next door you will find a nice gallery café, while the supermarket, the bakery, the liquor store and the pharmacy are just a few meters away.

The trolley stop is right next-door and will take you directly to the Metro Fix station if you want to avoid walking for 10 minutes.
Within 10 minutes walking distance you arrive at the famous Acropolis museum, the Parthenon, Syntagma square, Plaka, Thisio, the National Museum of Modern Art that just opened and all the famous historical spots of the city.
Just around the corner you will, also, find a little square with nice cafés, snack bars and trendy cocktail bars for your night out

name: Peaceful Oasis Just Steps from Acropolis
description:
Located in the center of Koukaki neighborhood (one of the trendiest neighborhoods in Athens), this peaceful apartment is just minutes from Acropolis, Plaka, and Filopappou Hill.

The location is ideal-it is a 3 minute walk from the Sygrou-Fix metro stop and a 10 minute walk from the Acropolis metro stop. Down the street from the house there are many tavernas, cafes, bakeries, bars including an organic food store on the corner. There are two lively pedestrian zones nearby.
neighborhood_overview:
Koukaki is a great mix in that it is a traditional Greek neighborhood but just steps away from the tourist and historical sites. One of the best bakeries in Athens is just a 5 minute walk from the apartment (Takis Bakery at 14 Misaraliotou st.). Other restaurants/bars within walking distance to check out include:
--Σκουμπρί (Skoubri) Fish Taverna at Drakou 12: 2 minute walk
--Ρίζα Ρίζα (Riza Riza) Bar at Drakou 19: 2 minute walk
--Brettos in Plaka at Kidathineon 41 (this is the second oldest distillery in Europe and a cool stop with its colorful bottles as a backdrop): 10 minute walk
--the Wine Point at Porinou 2 in Acropolis: 8 minute walk

A nice first full day from the apartment might be:
•Go to Takis Bakery (except Sunday, they are closed) to get something for breakfast, go across the street to Coffee Dive for your coffee and then take a leisurely walk up the Dionysiou Areopagitou pedestrian walkway to the Open Air Bus. Take the 90 minute ri

name: Roof top, internet connection guaranteed>190Mbps
description:
Very fast and reliable Internet connection at 190Mbps DL and 19Mbps UL (measured).
Bright and spacious 85sqm fully equipped apartment located within walking distance of the busy historical centre of Athens yet in a safe and quiet residential area which is ideal for people that want to explore the Ancient Greek sites or the Modern Greek nightlife or even both ... and even more!!!
neighborhood_overview:
Ridiculously close to all main attractions of downtown Athens with an average walking distance of 2km you will only need to worry about transportation on your way back to the airport. The place is ideally located in the intersection of three key areas of downtown Athens: Kerameikos, Ano (Upper) Petralona and Theseio.
Ano Petralona
Petralona is a tranquil and beautiful hideout just south of the city and is split, (roughly by the metro train line that runs through it) into Kato Petralona and Ano Petralona.
A walk to Ano Petralona seems like a journey through time, at an old neighbourhood of Athens with low houses and interior well-cared yards. It is one of the few areas that maintain a classic old Athenian vibe, without being too noisy or overcrowded. Cretan delicacies accompanied by raki and rakomelo, recipes from the island of Serifos, tsipouro from Volos with dishes of seafood and meat, dishes from Mani and a lot more await you at the taverns and restaurants of Petralo
host_about:
I was born and raised in Crete, at the South end of the country. Left for studies in mainland Greece after of which I moved to the UK where I worked for about 4 years in the telecoms industry.
When returning back to Greece I had to choose between living in busy and noisy Athens or return back home. I chose the latter and since then I am working as an IT teacher for ages between 16 and 18.
I like sports a lot and I am quite energetic but mountaineering is my thing. I do like to travel and I have done my part of travel around the globe (not quite finished yet, though). Therefore, I think I have a good understanding of the needs of someone staying away from home. name: The Chess Garden of Athens
description:
Super eco-friendly Athenian House that keeps the atmosphere of the 19th century, at the region of Exarchia.

This 30sq.m house was fully renovated on the 8/2022, has a private back yard and is characterized as "traditional monument Athenian house" by the ministry of Civilization.

Walking distance to metro, Archeological museum and the biggest park in Athens, bars, restaurants.

Located in a lovely pedestrian street which is an ideal location to start exploring Athens and stay like a local!
neighborhood_overview:
•Exarcheia is considered one of the most artistic neighborhoods in Athens. You can surely stay as a local and have a walk around the center.

•Everything is located within a few minutes’ walk: The biggest park of Athens, lots of cafes, restaurants, theatres, groceries, pharmacies, bakeries, convenient stores, super markets, boutiques, hair salons, you name it, it is nearby! I can suggest you great restaurants with a lot of character, just 5 minutes on foot from the house. 3 of them are called "ama laxei" , "avli" and "atitamos". "Exostrefis" is also great, in the top of the hill, 5minutes on foot.

• The National Archeological museum is just 5 minutes on foot and the park also, which you should definately visit.

•Kolonaki region, which is the Mayfair of Athens, with its small boutiques and luxurious shops is also less than 1km away.
• Acropolis is just 2,8 km away.
•The French Institut (Institut Francais) is ~200m away
•Lycabetus hill 1

Welcome to Olala Homes, where modern design and comfort come together to create the ultimate experience. With over 100,000 satisfied guests, we know how to provide a seamless and enjoyable digital experience for your stay.

Our worldwide accommodations range from stylish studios to luxurious villas, all designed with attention to detail to provide the ultimate comfort and care. Every Olala Homes property includes fast Wi-Fi, a Nespresso coffee machine, and amenities for families with children (where applicable). Because we know these little touches help make your stay truly special.

And - no more waiting in long lines to check-in! Our smart lock system allows you to self check-in at any time, giving you the freedom to arrive at your convenience and start enjoying your trip right away.

Join the Olala Homes experience and discover more than just a place to stay.

name: Hidesign Athens Art Loft  with Acropolis view
description:
An artistic, spacious and bright 171sqm Penthouse, filed with natural light from 12 meters of city view windows. As it is located on the 6th floor of a building, in the heart of the historical centre of Athens, this loft has a stunning view of the Acropolis, Lycabettus Hill and all over the city.
Museums, restaurants, bars, shops etc are accessible within walking distance.

Enjoy the luxury, comfort and elegance while staying in our residence.
neighborhood_overview: Enjoy the benefits of the central location. Many museums and galleries are just a few minutes away. Restaurants, bars, cafes, supermarkets are located near the apartment.
host_about:
Hidesign Athens Apartments & Villas was created fifteen years ago, when we decided to expand the services of our architecture office and combine our skills and passion to offer accommodation to people seeking to explore Greece. 

Our aim is to provide you with a unique home rental experience that combines the comforts of a luxury hotel and upscale hospitality in a family context.

A team member will always welcome you and be at your disposal for advice and suggestions that only a local can provide.

All of our houses are high designed, stylishly decorated and carefully located in the heart of Athens, offering the best starting point to discover our beautiful city!

We hope that Hidesign Athens Apartments & Villas will become a wonderful and unforgettable experience in your voyage.

Tourism Organization Licence Number: one, zero, two, four, two, eight, zero

name: Acropolis view Athenian Yellow apartment @Syntagma
description: The Yellow Athenian apartment is the place to stay if you want to visit Athens and live like an Athenian! Inspired by the Attica sun this brand new apartment is made by a well-known architectural firm with luxury materials and is located in Syntagma square 200 meters from Syntagma metro station.The apartment lies on the 8th floor of the building and its quiet private balcony (you have to go through the shared corridor) with the breathtaking view of Acropolis will make your stay unforgettable!
neighborhood_overview:
From TripAdvisor ©
Perhaps the best place to get your bearings is
Syntagma Square, crowned by the imposing Parliament
building on its upper side and surrounded by other
large structures, such as the exclusive Hotel Grande
Bretagne. The grand avenues that lead towards Omonia
are also full of massive Neoclassical edifices like
the Numismatic Museum and those around smaller Platia
Kolokotroni. Here you will find lots of travel agents,
bookshops and fashion shops, especially on Ermou
Street. Just south of Syntagma Square, you can take a
breather in the lush National Gardens, which extend
into the grounds of the Zappeio palace and beyond to
the ancient Temple of Olympian Zeus.

name: Αtmospheric house next to the Metro with parking
description: The 100sqm apartment has two master bedrooms, a living room, a spacious kitchen, a bathroom and a parking spot. This well-connected house is a perfect choice for families or group of people. It's located in the heart of Athens just 2 minutes away from the Metro station Aghios Eleftherios, which is only 13min from Monastiraki, the most famous flea market in town, and 15min from Thisio, where you can walk through the pedestrian walkway in order to reach the “Parthenon” and the Acropolis museum.
neighborhood_overview:
The 100sqm apartment is located right in the heart of Athens, just 2 minutes walk from the Urban Railway station “Aghios Eleftherios” of metro Line 1 and only 30 minutes away from the Athenian Riviera by tram or bus. The Athens Piraeus Electric Railway (ISAP), better known as "Ilektrikos" on 27th February 2017 completed 148 years of operation. It connects Athens with Piraeus port, and the station of “Aghios Eleftherios” is in the middle of this route, so it’s really easy to connect with a lot of interesting tourist attractions, such as the Acropolis, the Parthenon, the Plaka Area, the Parliament Building on Syntagma Square (connection both to Line 3, blue, of the Metro and the Tram network system of Athens) and the Panathenaic Stadium near “Zappion” National garden.

“Aghios Eleftherios” station is only 10 minutes from “Omonia” square (where you can change to Line 2 of the metro, red line), and 13 minutes from “Monastiraki”, the most famous flea market in Athens. There, you c
host_about:
“Travel is the only thing you buy that makes you richer”!
This is our moto! We are a couple that loves to travel around the world! We know what are we looking for in a house when we explore a city! Super clean, comfortable and safe place to stay with all the amenities provided in order not to worry about anything else, but how to spend our days pleasantly! 
That’s exactly the way we created our own house for our guests! We also provide recommendations to inform our guests about the historic and atmospheric capital of Greece, as well as the best places all over Athens and the clean beaches and close to the city amazing Greek islands in order to live like a local!

name: Apartment in Kolonaki 3min from Evangelismos metro
description: A tasteful and minimal apartment in Kolonaki
neighborhood_overview:
Stylish Kolonaki is a hub for upscale shopping, where international labels and Greek designer boutiques share space with sleek concept stores and galleries. Mid-range and fine dining restaurants offer global cuisines as well as modern takes on Greek cooking, and trendy bars have live jazz or DJs. 

Various museums are within a few minutes walk such as the museum of "War", the "Benaki" museum, the "Cycladic Art" museum, the "Byzantine" museum and the Acropolis museum.

name: #303 Down Town prvt room w. prvt bathroom
description: This cozy private studio/room renovated in 2024 is located in the heart of historic Athens. It consists of a private room having its own private bathroom, toilet and kitchenette. The "Monastiraki" metro stop is 2 minutes walking distance, as well as major bus lines. In the immediate vicinity there is a plethora of well-known bars, restaurants, taverns, theaters and music halls, and it is only a few minutes away from all the major sightseeings Athens has to offer.
neighborhood_overview:
Psyri, a hip neighborhood, used to have in its premises the majority of the leather traders and craftsmen till the mid 80s’. Now, it has repositioned itself into a vibrant area full of stylish bars, traditional cafes and restaurants.

While walking during the daytime you can meet a variety of people, from businessmen to men selling and bargaining used stuff on the street.

Acropolis, the Acropolis museum, Plaka, Monastiraki flea market, as well as Syntagma square and all the upbeat Athens neighborhoods are in the immediate vicinity.

name: Downtown artistic retreat, Neapoli, Central Athens
description: This is a lower ground floor flat, an easygoing, arty space with a small balcony at the back. We are an artistic family, I am a photographer and my husband is a painter. This lovely space used to be our studio, it is a great place for work and concentration or relaxation. It's usually very quiet, and due to it's position, the temperature is always ideal (cool in the summer, warm in the winter). It is decorated with our own original artworks. A folding bed may be provided at no extra charge.
neighborhood_overview: The flat is located in central Athens, in the area of Neapoli. It is great for exploring downtown Athens on foot. Everything you might need (supermarket, cafés, grocery stores, taverns and eating places) is within a few minutes walk, and the Kallidromiou Str fruit and vegetable market (every Saturday morning) is at 3 mins walk.

Only 5' walk from metro station Sygrou-Fix (red line) and tramway (which can take you to seaside regions, such as Faliro and Glyfada). There is also a bus stop 20m from the flat. neighborhood_overview:
Extract from ''Lonely Planet''
Kolonaki is an adjective as much as a district: it best epitomises the Athenian elite. Undeniably chic, Kolonaki is where old money mixes with the nouveau-riche and wannabes. Named after a tiny obscure column in the central Plateia Kolonakiou (Kolonaki Sq), Kolonaki stretches from Syntagma to the foothills of Lykavittos Hill, and is home to consistently popular cafes, restaurants, galleries, museums, boutiques and stylish apartment blocks. The area also contains a couple of notable museums and cultural institutions, which add to the air of nobility. The leafy upper reaches of Kolonaki transition into Lykavittos Hill, the highest point in central Athens. The wooden amphitheater up here hosts regular concerts during the summer.
Morning: Watch the world go by while fuelling up with coffee on Plateia Kolonakiou or at nearby Filion. Once you’re sated, head out to three of the best museums in Athens: Museum of Cycladic Art, Byzantine & Christian Muse
host_about:

I've been to many places around the world but need to admit that 2 are my favorite ones (outside Greece) Bali and Toscane Italy.
I truly believe that hospitality is not only a mater of respecting, being friendly and helping ones guests or travelers in general but also reflects how much one loves his/her home place.  So I try to do my best to make my guests' stay in Athens as comfortable as possible in the same way that I would expect from my hosts when traveling ...

neighborhood_overview:
Koukaki is one of the cutest neighborhoods in Athens, safe, quiet and friendly.
Conveniently nestled on the foot of Philopappos hill and only a few minutes away from the magnificent Acropolis, Koukaki’s prime location is one of the reasons the neighborhood has turned into a hotspot for both locals and travelers.

It offers the ideal combination of being very close to all the monuments in the historical center of Athens, while at the same time retaining a traditional character, reminiscent of what Athens looked like years ago.

Located at the heart of Athens is an excellent starting point to discover it. Explore the historical, commercial and artistic center but enjoy also the cozy restaurants and cafes and the small bars of the area!

name: Acropolis Grand Residence, Stunning Views
description:
Located in a 1930’s neoclassical building, directly in front of the Temple of Olympian Zeus, this masterfully completely renovated residence is a superb choice for your next stay in Athens.
This spectacular and spacious 4 bedroom/3 bathroom residential jewel also features a living room with a convertible large sofa bed with a full mattress, high ceilings, and wooden floors. A perfectly comfortable home for 2 up to even 8 guests.
neighborhood_overview: The residence is located at 12 Syggrou avenue which is a stone’s throw away from all the major historical attractions. The Acropolis Metro Station is 150 meters away and other public transportation stops are within 50 meters away. Acropolis historical monument is 300 meters away and The New Acropolis Museum is 150 meters away as well as the Herodion venue and ancient Theater of Dionysus. Next, to the apartment, you can find the Ancient Agora, Temple of Zeus and other historical and cultural monuments. All shops such as bakery, supermarket, grocery store, and variety of small typical Greek taverns and cozy cafes are in a walking distance. Within walking distance from the apartment are other major landmarks such as Syntagma square, Plaka area, Monastiraki market as well as the major city’s shopping hotspots.

name: No5 Theo Homeybee Nea Kipseli
description:
Hello Homey!

Delightful small penthouse with a big terrace offering a great view of the athenian landscape, located in the beautiful neighbourhood of Kypseli, close to the center of Athens. Ideal for loving couples, the apartment is close to public transport (buses and trolleybuses) with easy access to the historic center of Athens and a variety of must-see places and exquisite cultural monuments.
neighborhood_overview:
The most charming and colorful neighbourhood in the heart of Athens.
“Kypseli” in Greek means hive, and the reasons behind its naming can be easily justified through a short walk along its colorful and charming streets, populated by people from countries and nationalities all around the world. Multicultural and boheme in its own special way, Kypseli is a lovely area to explore, with a variety of cafés, restaurants and cultural meeting points. Pedion Areos Park near the apartment and Fokionos Negri’s pedestrian road are also great options for your morning walks, or even workouts - in case you’re the active type of person!
host_about:
Hello, I'm Theo.
  I live in the neighborhood of Exarcheia and I deal exclusively with the short-term rental of my privately owned apartments, so I have the opportunity to have discreet but direct contact with my guests and I will be very happy to help your smooth stay in Athens.
  I live very close to all my apartments and, as I am fully committed to the convenience and care of my guests' accommodation, I am always happy to meet new people and share local tips and "inside information" of the city.

  During the summer, I am also happy to have my guests at home for coffee or a drink - my house has a wonderful terrace with stunning views of Lycabettus, the Parthenon and the cityscape of Athens.  You'll love it!  In any other case, you will probably meet  coffee of the Exarcheion say hello and have a raki with me!

  We hope to see you soon!

description:
This is a stunning apartment of 125 sq. m. Its decoration is modern, built around some vintage Art Deco furniture from the 30s.
It is located right at the back entrance of the Acropolis Museum, and less than 100 meters away from Dionysiou Areopagitou street and the Acropolis metro station.

The apartment is on the 2nd floor of a typical Athenian building and it can host up to 8 guests. It has three bedrooms:
The Green room with a double bed and a private bathroom.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the heart of historical Athens!
The district is ultra quiet and safe and consists the ideal solution for those who want to explore on foot significant places of historic interest such as Plaka, Monastiraki, the Parthenon, the ancient market of Athens, Herodion theater, the Museum of Modern Art as well as the museum of Acropolis which is only a few meters away.
Furthermore, within a 2 minute walk from the house, you can choose from a variety of restaurants, bars, coffee shops, ATMs, convenient stores, bakery (one of the most famous bakeries in the city is right behind our building), pharmacy e.t.c.

name: Spacious Apartment in Koukaki area close to Metro
description: Close to the Acropolis, this recently refurbished one-bedroom apartment offers proximity to all the major sights and attractions. Perks include a private balcony overlooking the city. Inside, you'll find an open-concept kitchen, living and dining area featuring a spacious sofa. Complete with a large smart TV, WiFi, air conditioning, and much more, this apartment is your ideal home base in Athens.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is ideally located in Koukaki, “one of the top 5 must-visit neighbourhoods” in Athens as decreed by nocarz. The Acropolis and all the main attractions like Plaka and Thiseio are within walking distance, while the quaint neighbourhood of Mets and the Temple of Olympian Zeus can also be easily accessed on foot.

The “Syggrou Fix” station with metro, bus and tram connections is a few minutes away from your doorstep and the hip and happening pedestrianised streets of Koukaki at a stone’s throw. Take a stroll and discover traditional meze restaurants (tapas), sophisticated Greek dining places, and wine and cocktail bars. With hipster spots and more authentic options, you can take your pick as your mood strikes.

Bakeries, grocery shops, supermarkets, hairdressers, arts and crafts shops and mini-markets abound in the surrounding area so you can find anything you need at all hours of the day.

host_about:
We are thrilled to welcome you to one of our nocarz apartments in Athens, our goal is to ensure that you have a five-star experience in staying with us. 

We are part of a local fun and exciting hospitality group called MyGreekVacations managing more than 100+ beautifully designed custom-made apartments inspired by our travels and our stays in nocarzs around the world. The experience of meeting so many lovely people along the way is something we particularly enjoy, and the city of Athens is a hub where you can always find things to experience, see and do and we can’t get enough of it.

Our priority is to create a comfortable, relaxing and “home away from home” experience for our guests, a “workation” atmosphere for those who wish to combine business with leisure and to always be readily available and provide as much info and assistance as possible; all the things we value when traveling somewhere new ourselves.

Our home is your home! We treat our guests like lifelong friends and we love to spoil them during their visits.

We hope to see you soon.

name: Andreas Studio
description: Sunny and comfortable apartment on 3rd floor in the center of Exarcheia, a colorful and lively neighborhood of Athens.
neighborhood_overview:
Exarcheia is one of the most exciting areas of Athens. Very lively and multicultural, the neighborhood offers you an active day and an intense night.
There are many kiosks int Exarcheia square and a pharmacy is just at the corner.
About ten minutes walk to the Archaeological Museum, ten minutes to Omonia Metro station, about fifteen minutes to Panepistimio and twenty minutes to Syntagma.
There are plenty of cafes, bars, live music stages, traditional and modern taverns and restaurants. Many traditional groceries, bakeries, small book stores, printing houses and some traditional music instrument makers.
You can also experience a live exhibition of graffiti by walking in the streets of Exarcheia.

description:
The flat is located on a lovely, quiet pedestrian street. It's a penthouse on the 4th floor, recently renovated with two spacious balconies. There are two Metro stations near by, Metaxourgeio and Kerameikos 10 min / 15 walking distance. Metaxourgeio is a vibrant and artistic neighborhood with lots of new hip cafes, theaters and restaurants and it's only a 5 min walk away.
If you want to experience night life with clubs Gazi is a 10 min walk away.
neighborhood_overview:
The 50 coolest neighbourhoods in the world (TIME OUT
METAXOURGEIO

The once-grand neighbourhood of Metaxourgeio in Athens was almost abandoned for years, but now a patchwork of artists, activists and NGO volunteers are breathing fresh life into it. Its crumbling neoclassical buildings are emblazoned with emotionally-charged murals by local graffiti writers. Shabby-looking brothels and squatter spots – tragic reminders of the decade-long economic downturn – have slowly given way to bars and tavernas that hum with activity until the early hours. The Communitism Project, a huge mansion being restored by local and refugee artists, houses exhibitions, film screenings, workshops and parties; it encapsulates young Athenians’ creative energy and ability to make something from nothing. Metaxourgeio is a neighbourhood in that magical, transitional phase where it truly feels as if anything could happen next.

https://www.timeout.com/coolest-neighbourhoods-in-the-world

neighborhood_overview:
Kallimarmaron, the only stadium in the world made entirely from marble is just 500 meters away. Acropolis and the historical center are also some minutes’ walk away. Plaka and the Acropolis Museum are at 1,8 Km away and the posh Kolonaki area with its high-end boutiques and chic eateries, is just 1 Km from your doorstep, and so is Syndagma square.

Next to Kallimarmaron, the leafy hill of Arditou, is an oasis of trees with plenty of beautiful paths for hiking and running. The National Garden of Athens, a great place to walk, run or just enjoy your coffee or drink amid luscious trees and flowers, Is at your fingertips too. Zappeio, a Neoclassical architectural gem is just 400m away - make sure to check out if there are any events running while you are in Athens!

Supermarkets and pharmacists are a few meters away. Sports amenities, including an Olympic size swimming pool and tennis courts are just around the corner as well, making this an amazing neighborhood to live

Ideally located for downtown convenience, steps from metro PETRALONA. Easy walk downtown & historic Athens, 7 min to Filopappou Hill of Muses. PETRALONA area is featured in Monocle’s video "Athens Favourite Neighbourhoods", attracts travelers & professionals living the local culture
neighborhood_overview:
ANO PETRALONA, recently featured in Monocle magazine’s video "Athens Favourite Neighbourhoods", is an excellent location for those who wish to live centrally, in a typically local neighborhood away from the tourist crowds.

The upcoming gentrification of historic hubs in central Athens (zone 1) particularly ANO PETRALONA, seemed the perfect location for seekers of a true urban experience. The area caters to locals, and lately we see an influx of young urbanites as well.

Despite elements of the occasional pothole and graffiti, ANO PETRALONA’s spirit of a bygone era with its traditional establishments and old-stone houses and pastel colors, is being revived by young creatives, global nomads, and travelers, who enjoy authentic culture. This is a friendly neighborhood, with all amenities nearby (supermarkets, organic store, hairdressers, dry-clean, baker, restaurants, etc.).

ANO Petralona is popular for its summer open-art cinema, unique tavernas and quaint

host_about:
Born and raised in Athens; two different generations, mother and daughter, sharing the same admire for our beautiful city and the same passion for travelling and dancing.

Anny  is a Marketing and Communication graduate and a Tourism Management postgraduate that has been working for the past five years in a travel agency in the centre of Athens.  

Emilia is a lifetime entrepreneur from her early years dedicated to different fields of expertise.

We are dedicated to provide our guests with the essence of the Authentic Greek Hospitality. We are looking forward to welcome you in our amazing historical city, a city of ancient history, breathtaking views, scenic alleys, picturesque neighborhoods, romantic sunsets, Mediterranean beaches, traditional food, art, nightlife, sunny days and warm hearts.

One of my dreams is to travel throughout the world, meet different cultures and keep filling my album of life with unique pictures of different places. However, while people are the ones that give life to the beauty of a country, I am really pleased to become a part of your Greek experience and assist you to fill your own album of life with pictures of my fascinating city. It would be an honor to assist you in anything you may need during your stay in Athens and provide you with every information you may require.

We are really happy to welcome you to our city, to make you feel like home and to share with you our passion for exploration and travelling and our love for the historical, vibrant, sunny and diverse city of Athens.

name: Spacious/2 bedroom/short walk to Acropolis ♥Athens
description:
Stylish and comfortable , brand new, 2 bedroom apartment. Renovated in March 2020. Very spacious (64 square metres!). Decorated with lots of love in a modern style. There is a personal touch: Repurposed furniture designer by the owner of the flat. Just behind "Agias Irinis': the most trendy square in Athens.
Walking distance to 3 metro stations (next to Monastiraki), a short walk to Acropolis. You will NOT need a car/metro while you stay with us, the location is the best of Athens!!!
neighborhood_overview:
The location is one of the best in Athens: "Agias Eirinis' square!
This little cute square is a hot spot of downtown Athens in Plaka. It is a place that will introduce you to the most hip aspect of Athens. The square, which stretches around the church with the same name above the central Athinas street, in the vicinity of Monastiraki district – a rather quiet spot until 2 years ago – keeps counting new entries. The old draper shops of the area were turned into trendy all-day spaces that are constantly crammed with people

The neighborhood is an awesome shopping district with all the stores and restaurants and everything you need within arms' reach.

name: Cosy flat in the heart of Athens (00000134293)
description: Sunny and cosy apartment, in the heart of Athens, spacious with a small yard to sit outside. The living room can be altered in order to host one more person on a sofa bed. The apartment is located close to Lycabetus hill, the archaeological museum and Kolonaki shopping center, 25' walk to get to the Acropolis and Plaka. Bars, restaurants, shops, movie theaters are a few meters away in a lively area!
neighborhood_overview: Neapoli Exarheion area is traditionally the neighbourhood where artists, intellectuals and students live. It has a long history of culture; it is a very lively area with young energy, full of bookstores, cafes, museums, galleries and restaurants. Kolonaki, an upper-middle class area with expensive and high quality design shops, art galleries and restaurants, is adjacent, reached by foot within a few minutes. Also the archaeological museum is reachable on foot in 6'.
host_about:
Ταξιδεύω απο πολύ νωρίς στη ζωή μου, έζησα 4 χρόνια στην Ν. Υόρκη στη δεκαετία του '80, είμαι δασκάλα χορού και ψυχοθεραπεύτρια. Έχω δημιουργήσει η ίδια, σχεδιάζοντας, διακοσμώντας και επιβλέποντας την ανακατασκευή κτισμάτων, όπως το στούντιό μου και το σπίτι μου.  Ξέρω έτσι τη διαδικασία της δημιουργίας και πόσο κόπο και χρήματα απαιτεί. Σέβομαι, είμαι υπεύθυνη ως προς τον χώρο  και μ' αρέσει να ζω σε όμορφο αισθητικά περιβάλλον με ενδιαφέροντες ανθρώπους. Δεν καπνίζω και προσπαθώ να ζω υγιεινά. Χρειάζομαι η κατοικία που βρίσκομαι να είναι καθαρή, να έχει τάξη αλλά και προσωπικότητα. Το σημαντικότερο όλων όμως για μένα είναι η θετική αλληλεπίδραση και η καλή επικοινωνία με τους ανθρώπους που έρχομαι σ' επαφή. Αγαπώ τις διαφορετικές κουλτούρες και εμπνέομαι απο την τέχνη, τον πολιτισμό. Είμαι αυτόνομος και συνεννοήσιμος άνθρωπος. Ζω μια γεμάτη ζωή στην πόλη μου.
Δεν μπορώ να ζω χωρίς την τέχνη, τη φύση, τις ζεστές σχέσεις, την ομορφιά, την αλλαγή και την εξέλιξη. Πηγαίνω τακτικά σε ταινίες κυρίως σινεφίλ, ακούω μουσική απο κλασική, μέχρι τζαζ, ροκ, ethnic, alternative rock, διαβάζω λογοτεχνία, ψυχολογία και ιστορία. Κάνω διαλογισμό μέσα απο την κίνηση για μένα και διδάσκοντας η ίδια-έχω εκπαιδεύσει πολύ κόσμό 27 χρόνια τώρα στην Ελλάδα και στο εξωτερικό. Θα με βρείτε σχετικά στο www.presentbody.com. Ως προς το φαγητό, χρειάζομαι η όμορφη γεύση να συνδυάζεται με υγιεινή διατροφή, προσπαθώ να μην τρώω συχνά κρέας και να αποφεύγω τα γαλακτοκομικά. Ως επισκέπτης είμαι υπεύθυνη, προσαρμόσιμη  και ξέρω να βάζω τα όρια μου όταν βλέπω πως μια κατάσταση δεν ανταποκρίνεται σε αυτό που χρειάζομαι. Ως οικοδεσπότης προσφέρω φροντίδα και φιλική επικοινωνία ώστε να νοιώσει ο άλλος άνετα. Βοηθάω τον ξένο σε αυτά που χρειάζεται και ακούω τις ανάγκες του. Του δίνω χώρο να γνωρίσει την καθημερινότητά μου ανάλογα με τη σχέση που έχω μαζί του. Ουσιαστικά κάθε φορά χρειάζεται να "μετράω" την απόσταση που κάνει και τους δύο να αισθάνονται όμορφα και λειτουργικά. Τα ταξίδιά μου συνήθως συνδυάζουν τη δουλειά(διδασκω στο εξωτερικό) με την απόλαυση που έχει κανείς όταν αλλάζει τόπο διαμονής, έστω και για λίγο. Έχω ταξιδέψει σε πολλές χώρες της Ευρώπης, Αμερική, και Ασία. 

Since early on in my life, I travel abroad, visiting other countries, getting familiar with their history and culture. During the 80s, I studied contemporary dance in NYC where I lived for 4 years. I am an international dance teacher and body psychotherapist. I have passion for the creation of space; thus, I have renovated and got personally involved with the reconstruction and decoration of various spaces including Present Body dance/movement studio and my flat. Having all this experience, I appreciate beauty and well-being; I enjoy living amongst interesting, cultured people; the quality of inner and outer environment is very important to me. I try to live respectful to my body and the place that surrounds me. Thus, I don’t smoke, and I enjoy good communication with the people that I meet. I love the arts, being in nature; I am open to new acquaintances, relationships that offer a ground of warmth, respect and  creativity.

The Athens area

name: The archaeologists' pied-à-terre (1-2 BR)
description:
Beautifully presented, light, airy, fully-furnished, air-conditioned two bedroom apartment on a quiet street in the heart of the vibrant Pangrati neighbourhood in central Athens, a short walk to all major attractions.

The apartment is situated on the raised ground floor of a small, older and immaculately-maintained residence, on a quiet residential street close to a variety of shops, cafes, bars, restaurants and other amenities.

Ideal for short breaks or longer stays.
neighborhood_overview:
Pangrati is at the epicentre of Athens’ rebirth, with its unique mix of older residential buildings and new restaurants, bars and boutiques adding to the already numerous tavernas and cafes long popular with locals. We chose to make Pangrati home because of its unique mix of old Athenian neighbourhood charm - and the local shops and services to serve its long time residents - with some of the city’s most modern nightspots and boutiques. For those seeking to sample the emergent Athenian contemporary culture scene, Pangrati plays host to some of the city’s most on-trend restaurants, cafes and bars, museums and galleries. A simple taverna meal, or an arthouse film and cocktails ‘til dawn, the choice is yours. All of this is but a few minutes’ walking distance to most of the city’s major cultural attractions, but blissfully free of the tourist crowds.

Within a few minutes’ walk from the apartment are all the amenities you could hope for to ensure a comfortable stay: a large supe
host_about:
I write, research and translate for a living. I enjoy travelling with my pack (my husband Frank and our wire fox terrier, Bjarni). 

I have been lucky to travel for work and pleasure, and I have come to the conclusion that a cosy, clean, well-equipped apartment in a real neighbourhood beats a hotel any day! 

I like to maintain contact with my guests, even when I am not around. Please feel free to message me with any questions about your stay.
