description: Our sophisticated minimalist studio located on the 4th floor has a spectacular location in the center of Athens. Walk to Syntagma Square & metro in less than 4 min. Seamless kitchen with stunning custom-made marble-look tiled countertop. The spacious sleeping quarter with high ceilings- luxurious Queen bed & spa-style walk-in shower. A large desk that can be used as a workspace and dining table. Superfast Wifi. Airconditioned. And best of all, walking distance to every major historic site!
neighborhood_overview: Plaka is the beloved neighbourhood surrounding the Acropolis an arguably Athens’ oldest neighbourhood. Because of Greek laws banning amplified music, Plaka has transformed from the groovy seventies nightclub district to a thriving area filled with restaurants, jewelry stores, boutiques, tourist shops, and cafés. It also provides immediate access to all archeological sites both well-known and some hidden gems! The famous Tower of the Winds (part of the ancient Roman Agora) is just a block up from Adrianou on Aeolou St! Though quite commercialized, Plaka is the quintessential experience of a village with narrow winding streets where traditional music can be heard around every corner and if you’re lucky, maybe even some magic takes place. There are several museums scattered throughout the area that are worth a visit including the Children's Museum; Music Museum; Greek Folk Art Museum; and Jewish Museum. If you are interested in contemporary art, head over to the Frissiras Museum of Contem

neighborhood_overview:
This apartment is located in Psirri, minutes walk away from Monastiraki and Plaka. Monastiraki station serves the Athens International airport and the port of Piraeus.
Plaka is the heart of Athens historical city centre, where most main monuments are located. Psirri is a place where you still find lovely artisan shops such as candle making and leather work shops. It has great restaurants, cafes, art spaces and an outdoor cinema where you can enjoy films in the original language. Y
ou will also find grocery stores, bakeries and the Athens Central Food Market, the famous Varvakios Agora Walking around Psirri can be deceiving as it has many old buildings and lots of street art.
The street art scene has produced many outstanding artists and their work is widely photographed and admired. The artisan shops, the residents who greet each other by their first names and the visitors create a place of unique character.

host_about:
Born and raised in Athens; two different generations, mother and daughter, sharing the same admire for our beautiful city and the same passion for travelling and dancing.

Anny  is a Marketing and Communication graduate and a Tourism Management postgraduate that has been working for the past five years in a travel agency in the centre of Athens.  

Emilia is a lifetime entrepreneur from her early years dedicated to different fields of expertise.

We are dedicated to provide our guests with the essence of the Authentic Greek Hospitality. We are looking forward to welcome you in our amazing historical city, a city of ancient history, breathtaking views, scenic alleys, picturesque neighborhoods, romantic sunsets, Mediterranean beaches, traditional food, art, nightlife, sunny days and warm hearts.

One of my dreams is to travel throughout the world, meet different cultures and keep filling my album of life with unique pictures of different places. However, while people are the ones that give life to the beauty of a country, I am really pleased to become a part of your Greek experience and assist you to fill your own album of life with pictures of my fascinating city. It would be an honor to assist you in anything you may need during your stay in Athens and provide you with every information you may require.

We are really happy to welcome you to our city, to make you feel like home and to share with you our passion for exploration and travelling and our love for the historical, vibrant, sunny and diverse city of Athens.

host_about:
Our philosophy is "whenever you travel abroad, live like a local, not a visitor!"

We always enjoyed traveling around the world and learning about other cultures.

First came our fascination to meet people around the globe, exchange stories and see our city in different ways through their eyes. This fueled a desire to create “aeiphoria” suites into the historical centre of Athens and yet far enough from the hustle and bustleat. 
The studios are exactly as described and in a superb location, in the  heart of the city.

We strongly believe that we can relate to very different types of people and help them experience Greek hospitality, giving priority to high standards of accomodation and attending to the needs and expectations of guests!

We consider each one of you our guests and not customers. 
We will be very happy to give you recommendations during your stay, in order to feel "local". And of course to support you when you are exploring Athens. 

Aiming to continiously improve the holiday experience of our guests....let us be your host!

description: Experience Athens like a true local from this stylish boho-chic retreat at Syntagma Square! neighborhood_overview:
Discover the secrets of Athens at this Boho Chic apartment. This beautiful two-bedroom apartment in the liveliest location of the Athenian historical triangle is in the second floor of a quiet building. The most important sights and monuments are only a few steps away. The apartment is next to the central Syntagma Metro station, only 100 meters on foot (2 minutes away).

Located in the heart of the city center and next to the main shopping streets, you will enjoy the best Athens has to offer. The city’s most popular cafés, bars, and restaurants are just a few steps away.

You will begin your journey at the very heart of the city, buzzing with shopping centers and a variety of entertainment venues. Visit Syntagma Square, stand in front of the Greek Parliament House, and pay tribute to the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier dedicated to the fallen soldiers at war. The Tomb is guarded by Evzones (an honorary guard), and since you are there, don’t miss out on visiting the Nati

host_about:
Find your own home in Greece, for holidays or any kind of travel via Golden Home Holidays!
The beauties of Greece invite you to enjoy the country's light, sea, history, culture, ambiance, hospitality... 
We are your new host. We take you beyond the narrow confines of a hotel and welcome you into a house that shall be your home, for as long as you wish -on beautiful Greek islands, in Athens and in numerous destinations worth visiting. We have secured high-quality accommodation and service facilities in luxury villas, select country houses as well as beautiful apartments for a dream holiday or a business trip tailored to your needs, aiming to make you feel at home. 
Visit museums and monuments that attract millions of visitors from all over the world. Delight in the renowned blue sky of Attica. Enjoy a short or longer trip to the wonderful islands or an excursion to the dozens of well-organized beaches and dreamy quiet coasts. Indulge in a dream cruise in the astonishing Aegean Sea. Stroll around plazas, shopping streets and historic quarters. Feel the beauty of simple pleasures in a typical Greek coffeehouse or local tavern. Savoir the theater, music and arts in a country known as the cradle of civilization, which has fostered culture through the centuries. Check out the numerous night entertainment options in a city that never sleeps!
We have created an alternative approach to holidays and to business travel, especially for those of you who love to combine the coziness of a home with your favorite amenities, without a strict schedule, but with special care. You deserve to enjoy unforgettable holidays, tailored to your own needs! You are free to travel for business in your own home in Greece!

This neighbourhood, was where the great philosopher Plato, decided to build the first university of the ancient world, the Academy of Plato. It is a place anyone can visit, any time of the day and within this green place, you will come across people from every aspect of Athenian life.

name: Modern and Cozy Apartment on Parthenon Hill
description:
Experience a warm hospitality in one of the most privileged locations in the Center of Athens. Nestled in the serene green area of Filopappou Hill, central, easily accessible and within walking distance of Athens top attractions such as the Acropolis, Plaka, Monastiraki, and many museums.
Experience the Myth and History of 3000 years, walk the most famous pedestrian street in the world and feel the aura and the energy of a unique atmosphere under the Acropolis Sacred Hill.
neighborhood_overview: Philopappos Hill The Hill and Monument of Filopappou in Athens: Filopappou (or Philopappou) Hill is a green area to the south west of the Acropolis. It is a favourite promenade of the Athenians and there you can have great views of the Acropolis, the whole city of Athens and the Aegean Sea that surrounds Attica. In 115 AD, a monument dedicated to the exiled Roman Prince Gaius Julius Antichus Philopappos of Commagene (region in ancient Armenia) was erected on top of the hill. After his exile, Philopappos was settled in Athens, became an Athenian citizen and held religious and civil offices. He was considered a great benefactor and was highly esteemed by the residents. The grave monument of Philopappos was constructed of marble from Mount Pentelikon, near Athens, and Mount Imittos, to the south east of Athens. Close to the monument and obscured from sight, there stands a stone structure with iron gates. According to the tradition, this is the prison where the great Greek philosopher Socr

neighborhood_overview:
Pedion tou Areos or Pedion Areos is one of the largest and green neighborhoods in Athens. The neighborhood has the same name as the largest public parks in Athens - Pedion tou Areos that stretches over an area of 27.7 hectares.
The park was designed in 1934 and its purpose was to honor the heroes of the 1821 Greek Revolution, 21 of which are represented in the park as marble bustles.

The neighborhood is a safe and pleasant walking area, nearby you can find several fashion stores, coffee bars, pastries and tavernas with delicious local dishes.

Catalin and Violeta

name: Elegant, spacious aprt for 6, jacuzzi @ Kolonaki
description: Welcome to Athens! Our elegant, spacious and sunny apartment combines the luxury of a hotel suite and the comfort of a private residence. Our apartment is designed to cover every need and to provide comfort to our guests. It is located at Kolonaki, at the heart of the city. Minimal decoration and modern design in a residence that can hosts up to 6 people and it has a private terrace with open jacuzzi. Here you will live memorable moments!
neighborhood_overview:
Our apartment is located at the heart of the city, at Kolonaki, one of the most known and historic areas. Under the Lycabettus hill, Kolonaki is one of the aristocratic areas of Athens with many activities and places to visit.

We suggest you walk through the area and discover the market and the hidden galleries between the neoclassical buildings and the modern apartment buildings. Only a few meters away from our apartment is Kolonaki square where you will find in the nearby streets high-quality restaurants, small coffee places, and many stores.

Very close to our apartment you will find the pedestrian street “Voukourestiou” where are many stores with haute couture and the pedestrian street “Ermou”, the most famous marketplace of Athens. Visit the unique museum of Cycladic History that you will meet a few blocks away from Kolonaki square and the Benaki Museum which has collections from all centuries.

Of course, Lycabettus Hill is one of our suggestions
host_about:
Hello! I am Eva and I will be happy to host you! 
I love to travel around the world and gather experiences. I also love to share with my guests small secrets about my city!

name: Acropolis Holmes Residence
description: Ideally located in the heart of Athens, the neighbourhood of Koukaki, right next to the Acropolis, this modern and elegant apartment is perfect for those who want to make the most out of their stay downtown. Balancing between the many historic sites and the bustle and vibe the Athens life has to offer, it is ideal for city life adventures and cultural experiences!
neighborhood_overview: Nearby the apartment, you can find the Ancient Agora, the Temple of Zeus, and other historical and cultural monuments. All shops such as a bakery, supermarket, grocery store, and a plethora of Greek taverns, restaurants, and cozy coffee places are within walking distance. Other major landmarks such as Syntagma Square, Plaka area, Monastiraki market as well as the major city’s shopping hotspots of Ermou Street and Voukourestiou Avenue are also within walking distance from the apartment. Athens living at its best!
host_about:
We are Bill & John two young entrepreneurs with family ties. We were both born in Athens and continue living in this fascinating city. We have both spent our early years in the tourism and hospitality industry assisting our family in its hotel and tour operator ventures. Bill holds a bachelor in Hospitality Management & International Tourism and John holds a bachelor in Marketing & Communication. 
We are committed to greeting our guests with large measures of Hellenic Filoxenia! 
We both love traveling and discovering new cultures.

name: Blue Suite - K23 Color Suites
description: The K23 Blue Suite is an elegant choice for all travelers. Measuring 26 m², the Suite offers all the necessary facilities and amenities for a high-quality experience. It features a queen-size bed, a spacious living room with a sofa, a fully equipped kitchen, air conditioning, a smart TV, and a 12 m² terrace with a pergola and stunning views of the city. The bathroom also offers a private hammam (available upon request for an additional fee) for those seeking ultimate relaxation.
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the heart of Athens, K23 Color Suites offers guests a convenient and stylish place to stay while exploring the city. The complex is located just 5 minutes from the Omonoia metro station, making it easy to get around and see the sights. Its central location also puts it within easy reach of many cultural attractions, including the Acropolis, the National Archaeological Museum, the Ancient Roman marketplace, and the historic neighborhood of Plaka.
In addition to its cultural offerings, the location of K23 Color Suites is also ideal for business travelers, with the Athens International Airport and Piraeus Port just 35 km away. And for those looking to experience the nightlife of Athens, the complex is surrounded by a variety of restaurants, cafes, bars, and nightclubs. Whether you're traveling for leisure or business, K23 Color Suites is the perfect choice for a memorable stay in Athens.

name: Modern Apartment in Plaka 10 min walk to Acropolis
description: This stylish two-bedroom apartment welcomes all those who wish to soak up all that Athens has to offer. Within walking distance to all landmarks and attractions, it’s right where the city’s heart beats. The well-designed space sports boho-chic furnishings and a balcony, while facilities include Smart TVs and a washing machine – everything you need whether you are travelling for work or play.
neighborhood_overview:
With an enviable location near Syntagma square and the Parliament and the adjacent historic neighborhood of Plaka, the flat sits in the most central and vibrant area of Athens, just minutes away from all the major city landmarks. There is much history, art and an unlimited choice of cafes, restaurants, shopping and nightlife in and around this neighborhood.
The emblematic Acropolis and the iconic Odeon of Herodes Atticus that has been staging musical and theatrical performances for two full millennia, are at 1 km. Likewise Zappeion, a Neoclassical masterpiece that hosts all sorts of exhibitions and events is just 700 meters away and so are the National Garden of Athens – a great place to walk, run or just enjoy your coffee and drink amid luscious trees and flowers. Also, the posh Kolonaki area with its high-end boutiques and chic eateries, is about 1,5 Km from your doorstep.
host_about:
Welcome to MyGreekVacations! We're thrilled to have you join us in one of our unique, beautifully-designed apartments here in Athens. name: Luxury Apartment near Acropolis-LivingStone Silver
description: Enjoy a luxury experience at this centrally-located 85 s.q.m. entire place. An amazing apartment in the heart of Athens! In vibrant neighbourhood of Petralona. A luxurious apartment constructed with amazing marbles and glass walls.
neighborhood_overview: Living Stone Silver is located in Petralona, the artistic, vibrant & bohemian neighborhood in the heart of Athens, below the shadow of the Acropolis. It is reached easily by the central  Railway “Petralona” station. The area around it, the Historic Centre of Athens, is the literal heart of the city’s rich nightlife, while also being exceptionally close to all major landmarks of the Greek capital.
host_about:
I am Giannis, an entrepreneur and a coffee shop owner. I really like meeting new people from all over the world while travelling or, even better, having them visit Athens and hosting them! I am energetic and forward-thinking (or so my friends and colleagues say about me), a physical as well as intellectual person. I enjoy football and alternative sports, but also reading good books and of course activities like puzzles and escape rooms, things I do for a living!
I have travelled all over Europe and Africa and I consider Paris and Budapest my favourite destinations, places of history but also modern and cosmopolitan, having many things to see and do.
Films and TV shows about historic events and murder mysteries are my favorite and recently I got infatuated with Money Heist (“La casa de Papel”). while my literature of choice is mainly classic and timeless. I could not imagine myself as I am today without having read “Around the World in 80 Days” in my childhood!
I enjoy Mediterranean and Greek traditional cuisine, but I would like to taste every culinary tradition the world has to offer.
As for a life moto? “You can learn more for a person by playing with him/her for an hour than by a year-long conversation”, by Greek philosopher Plato.

host_about:
Dear Guest, 

A very warm welcome to Athens Boutique Residence.

We appreciate that you have chosen to stay at our premises. We will do everything to ensure that your overall experience is more comfortable. Your personal satisfaction in our facilities is our main priority.

The Diplomat’s ABR  Trikoupi 95
Situated in the historic street of Charilaou Trikoupi 95,

The spaces apart from the 21 comfortable apartments, offers a nice and comfortable rooftop terrace. A place where you can enjoy  spectacular views over the city of Athens, and one of the most prized landmarks –  the Lycabettus hill from morning till night

The Diplomat’s  ABR Trikoupi 95 has been fully transformed into a place that welcomes business travellers, couples, families and friends, who seek an urban sanctuary in the heart of modern Athens
 

Should you require any additional help or information during your stay with us, please do not hesitate to contact our Lobby Manager, at the lobby of our premises or the support telephone line of Athens Boutique Residence.  For emergency matters you may contact the building supervisor, who is located at the ground floor next to the main entrance.  

May I take this opportunity to thank you for having chosen the Athens Boutique Residence and we look forward to serving you again in the near future.

Sincerely,


Your Athens Boutique Residence Team

name: Aristos Apartment Near Metro
description: Welcome to our charming 1-bedroom apartment in the heart of Athens. Located just steps away from the metro, you'll have easy access to all the city has to offer. The convenient neighborhood is filled with amenities perfect for solo travelers, couples, or small families. Our cozy apartment includes a fully equipped kitchen, comfortable living space, and an air-conditioned bedroom. Come stay with us and experience all that Athens has to offer from the comfort of your own centrally located retreat
neighborhood_overview:
The area of the apartment is located in the heart of the center of Athens and specifically in Victoria Square. The neighborhood is characterized by a wide variety of shops and businesses that serve every need of local residents. There are also many large supermarkets and shops that offer fresh local produce and essentials.

The neighborhood is friendly and peaceful, and offers easy access to public transportation, as it is located between three central Metro, Suburban and bus stations. In particular, Larissa station is the most central station of Athens, while offering direct connection to the port of Piraeus and Eleftherios Venizelos airport. The apartment is also within walking distance of the National Archaeological Museum and other major city attractions.
host_about: Welcome to City Suites! We're a vacation rental company that's all about making your stay in Athens as comfortable and stylish as possible. We've got a wide range of properties, including apartments, studios, and lofts, that are perfect for travelers of all types - whether you're here for a short or long stay. We take care in selecting and maintaining all of our properties, so you can be sure you'll have a comfortable and enjoyable stay.

name: Hera - Luxenia Suites
description: In a quiet street in one of the oldest areas of Athens - Plaka, with the famous Zappeion and the Temple of Zeus at the door, Luxenia Suites® provide the ideal getaway for all those seeking a luxurious and carefree stay!
neighborhood_overview: Plaka is a district in the center of Athens below the Acropolis. It borders to the south with the district of Makrigianni, to the east with the area of the Temple of Olympian Zeus and Zappeion, to the north with the commercial center of Athens and to the west with Monastiraki. It has been characterized as a traditional settlement. Plaka is one of the few districts of the city -if not the only one- which has been continuously inhabited since antiquity and was, among other things, the center of Ancient Athens. The direct connection of the area with the glorious past of Ancient Athens, which becomes obvious to the visitor from the dozens of monuments scattered in it have made it known -and not unfairly- as the "Quarter of the Gods".
host_about:
Hello everybody! 

We are Luxenia Apartments  team, and we will be very excited to host you in our property! 
We love meeting new people and really enjoy being nocarz Hosts. As we are born and raised in Athens, we are able to give you information on what to do and where to go while in Athens. We will ensure you a great stay, sharing our love for the city with you.
Furthermore, the combination of the professionalism and the excellent personal guest service, will offer you a delightful, exciting and trouble free stay in our apartments.

In our apartments we provide you:
- Air conditioning apartments with free Wi-Fi and satellite TV channels .
- Clean sheets and fresh towels.
- Bath amenities: shampoo, conditioner, body wash, body milk, slippers and hair dryer.
- Fully equipped small kitchen with fridge, oven, kettle, coffee machine, hot plates, crockery, and kitchen towels. 
- Safety Box, Washing machine and dryer, Iron and ironing board. 
- Easy entry through lockbox allowing you to enter whenever you want.
- Live support when you need it. 

Your excellent stay is our commitment.

Hope to host you soon!

name: Loft 1BD Apartment in the Center of Athens
description: This centrally-located flat is perfect for independent travelers looking to stay close to all the action in Athens. Located in the heart of Monastiraki and the picturesque Psirri neighbourhood, it offers an equipped kitchen with a refrigerator and oven, one bedroom and private bathroom with shower, as well as air conditioning and free WIFI. Ideal for exploring Athens's famous archaeological sites like Acropolis, Plaka area and Thission shopping district.
neighborhood_overview: This apartment is located in the very vibrant and central area of Athens, a short metro ride away from all points of interest, including the Acropolis Museum, Gazi Technopolis and Benaki museum. This area of Athens is buzzing with cozy restaurants, vibrant bars, and quaint cafes which are close by. The streets of Psirri and Monastiraki are a colorful melting pot of tiny antique and souvenir shops, the famous Flea Market, greek taverns and more. Several metro stations are located less than a minute's walk from the apartment (Monastiraki Metro station being the closest) so you can move anywhere in Athens.

name: Acropolis View Luxury Apart @ 400m Acropolis Gate
description: Sleep staring eternity. Amazing view of Acropolis from the balcony-living room-bedroom. This is a sophisticated, fully renovated apartment, in one of the most picturesque areas of the historic center. You are at a distance of 400m from the metro Thisio, 400m from the Gate of the Acropolis, 350 from the Odeon of Herodes Atticus, 900m from the new Museum of the Acropolis and the archaeological site as well as the enchanting Plaka. Perhaps the best choice for dreamy vacations in Athens.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in  the most beautiful and lively area of Athens, next to the gate of the Acropolis (500m) with countless cafe-bar-restaurants, taverns and anything else you may need during your stay, right next to the archaeological site of Acropolis, located right in the center of the historical triangle of Athens, . Υou can see the Temple of Hephaestus, the Pnyka, the hill of Filopappun and of course the Acropolis. The area around Panagiotara street in Athens is a vibrant and bustling part of the city, with plenty of highlights to offer visitors. Located in the center of Athens, this area is home to many historical and cultural landmarks, as well as numerous shops, restaurants, and cafes.

One of the most notable attractions in the area is the Acropolis, which is just a short distance from Panagiotara street. This ancient citadel is home to several impressive structures, including the iconic Parthenon, and is a must-visit for anyone interested in Greek history and culture.

Another popular landmark in the area is the National Archaeological Museum, which is home to an extensive collection of artifacts from ancient Greece. The museum is located just a few metro stops away from Panagiotara street, making it easily accessible for visitors.

neighborhood_overview: Metaxourgeio or Metaxourgeio is a neighborhood of Athens. The neighborhood is located north of the historical center of Athens, between Kolonos in the east and Kerameikos in the west, and north of Gazi. Metaxourgeio is often described as a transition neighborhood. After a long period of abandonment in the late 20th century, the area is gaining an artistic and modern neighborhood reputation due to the inauguration of many art galleries, museums, and trendy restaurants and cafes. [1] In addition, local efforts to beauty and revitalize the neighborhood reinforced the nascent sense of community and artistic expression. Throughout the neighborhood, anonymous works of art have begun to spring up with quotes and sayings in both English and ancient Greek, containing statements such as "Art for the sake of art" (Art for the sake of art). The guerrilla gardening also contributed to the beautification of this area, taking advantage of the abundant sunshine in Greece.
host_about: I enjoy  travelling around the world  with  my friends. host_about:
A very warm welcome from me, Theoharis, the owner of Vilaman ΙΚΕ, the property management company that is running this property.
Having traveled extensively in the Americas, SE Asia and Europe, and being a demanding traveller myself, I adapted my experiences to my native Greece and combined them with our philoxenia: the ancient greek word that literally means a “friend to a stranger” and is synonymous to hospitality. 
For Greeks however, it is something deeper than that., it is an unspoken cultural law that shows generosity and courtesy to strangers. 
In addition, my personal relationship with each property owner allows me to make sure that everything runs smoothly, as desired, so that our every guest feels at home at our properties and takes a unique experience and unforgettable memories back home with them.

name: Light-Filled, Central Athens Escape near Acropolis
description: Live your Athenian adventure right in the heart of it all! This modern, upscale apartment is easy walking distance from the city’s most stunning historic sites and surrounding restaurants, cafes, and shops (as well as some of its local hidden gems). Wake up to see the ancient Acropolis just minutes walking from the apartment, and just around the corner for a coffee and a traditional Greek pastry. Perfect for couples, solo, and business travelers.
neighborhood_overview:
Experience the vibrant energy of Athens by staying in the trendy neighborhood of Monastiraki. Known for its charming streets lined with colorful buildings, trendy bars, and delicious traditional tavernas, Monastraki is the perfect place to immerse yourself in the city's culture and nightlife. Take a stroll through the historic streets and discover hidden gems like traditional coffee shops, vintage boutiques, and street art murals.

At night, the neighborhood comes alive with music and laughter spilling out of the bars and tavernas, making it the perfect spot for a night out on the town. The area is also home to some of the city's best traditional Greek cuisine, and you'll find plenty of options to satisfy your appetite.

Located just minutes away from the city center and major landmarks like the Acropolis, Monastiraki Flea market and the Ancient Agora, our apartment in Psyrri offers the perfect base for exploring all that Athens has to offer. Whether you're here for

We're the masterminds behind several top-notch listings in our stunning city and on some lush islands, and we're here to make sure your adventure is nothing short of epic. Your flat is located in a pre-war building completely renovated in 2023 at a quiet street of the iconic Exarchia area. The humble neighborhood of the mid 19th century evolved to an area much favored by the newly emerging middle class at the time and for more than 150 years now, it has been the melting pot for cultural, artistic and political ideas, with an innovative city lifestyle only to be experienced in this area.

name: Fix 2bd apartment with Parthenon view
description:
We are happy to introduce you to one of our recent additions and best apartments with uninterrupted view across the Parthenon Temple Hill.
Its central location, among the city's most important attractions and museums, makes it unique. You can easily move around with a plethora of public transport: tram, metro, bus and a number of sightseeing double deck buses. Syngrou - Fix metro station is just across the street
neighborhood_overview:
Right on the edge of the Ancient City, minutes from the Parthenon (The Acropolis), is the Fix, the old beer factory which is now transformed into the National Museum of Contemporary Art Αthens (EMST).
Within walking distance, in the shadow of the Acropolis, the neighborhood of Koukaki, with its unevenly paved sidewalks lined with bitter orange trees, has an undeniably urban village feel. It is the lesser-known sister of Makriyianni, which, boasting the elegant Acropolis Museum on the sweeping cobbled esplanade of Dionysiou Areopagitou, has relegated Koukaki to the status of just another residential district.
Yet this unassuming neighborhood has begun to capture the attention of Athenians and visitors alike. For the latter, it is perhaps best known for its staggering popularity as an nocarz destination, ranking in the top five most interesting neighborhoods in the world to stay. It isn’t difficult to understand why.
The Parthenon is a former temple on the Athenian Acropol

name: Elegant & Modern Flat Near Panathenaic Stadium
description: Welcome to our centrally located gem in the heart of Athens! Nestled on the 1st floor of a well-maintained building with elevator access, this recently refurbished 50-sqm one-bedroom flat boasts modern comforts, and a serene ambiance, offering a haven for travelers seeking both convenience & tranquility. Located in the prestigious Pangrati area, just a 5-minute walk from Panathenaic Stadium and 5-15 mins from Athens' major attractions, our space is ideal for both business & leisure guests alike.
neighborhood_overview:
Experience Athens like a local from our comfy pad, where the city's energy meets cozy home vibes. Offering the perfect mix of location, safety, and convenience, our charming spot in the vibrant Pangrati neighborhood is just steps away from the buzzing "Plateia Plastira" and a quick 5-minute stroll from iconic spots like the Panathenaic Stadium (Kallimarmaro) and the leafy Athens National Garden.

Pangrati is a local favorite, loved by both residents and visitors for its lively vibe and great dining and bar scene. It's no wonder it made it to Time Out magazine's list of the "51 Coolest Neighborhoods in the World" in 2022!

The closest metro station "Evangelismos" is around a 10-minute walk, while Syntagma Square (home to the Greek Parliament) is a pleasant 15-minute stroll away. Athens' major archaeological/historical sites (Acropolis, Ancient Agora etc.), museums (National Gallery, Goulandri, Benaki, Cycladic Art, Military, Byzantine museum), most famous restaurants

neighborhood_overview:
Attiki is a large residential neighborhood located in the northwest part of Athens, Greece. It is one of the most densely populated neighborhoods in the city and is known for its multicultural and diverse community.

The area is well-connected to public transportation, with several metro and train stations within its boundaries, providing easy access to other parts of Athens. Attiki is also located close to the National Highway, making it easily accessible by car.

Attiki offers a wide range of amenities and facilities, including shops, supermarkets, restaurants, cafes, and bars. There are also several parks and open spaces in the area, such as the Pedion tou Areos Park, which is one of the largest parks in Athens.

Overall, Attiki is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood with a diverse population, excellent transportation links, and plenty of amenities to offer its residents.

neighborhood_overview:
☼A PERFECT LOCATION☼

Right in front of Metropoleos street, a vibrant single-lane street, the house is within a 200m radius of everything you would want to see in Athens over 24 hours, smack in the golden triangle of Monastiraki, Syntagma and the Acropolis.

☼PLAKA☼
Plaka is a favoured destination for locals and travellers alike who love to browse the little streets lined with independent fabric vendors, traditional barber shops, boutiques selling art, jewellery or local ceramics.
Known as the ‘neighbourhood of the gods’, Plaka is a fascinating site with neoclassical buildings that stand shoulder to shoulder with the quaint, island-style homes of Anafiotika and the ancient ruins.
Take in the local colour at sidewalk cafes and family-run tavernas that stay open until late, and drop by Cine Paris, one of the oldest open-air cinemas in Athens established in the 1920s.

name: Peaceful & Convenient  Kypseli Tree View Home
description:
Excellent location in the heart of Kypseli, a vibrant, safe, diverse, hip central Athenian neighborhood. Much to enjoy within short walking distance. Close to metro, parks, markets. 15 minutes to city center.
Spacious, quiet & comfortable 1 bedroom 1960s apartment, renovated while preserving some original charm, eclectically decorated and equipped for comfort and function with a full kitchen, new air-conditioners, washing machine, sound proof secure front door , wifi, sound system.
neighborhood_overview: Kypseli is a safe, vibrant,  diverse neighborhood with an artistic legacy, beloved by locals and foreigners alike. 3 blocks away is one of the largest green spaces in Athens: Pedion tou Areos park. 1 block away is the very popular Saint George square, perfect for an outdoor meal or coffee.  Beyond that the legendary Fokionos Negri park-lined pedestrian street. Within a small distance there are many great cafes, bars, restaurants, theaters,  galleries, markets.  Every thursday there is a large traditional farmers market right around the corner.  It is a short walk through the park to the Archeological museum and the legendary and lively Exarheia neighborhood. Also close to hiking areas with amazing views at Attiko Alsos & Lycabettus hill.
host_about: Originally from Greece, I currently split my time between Athens and NYC . I love to travel and to host fellow travellers!

The floor-to-ceiling windows exaggerate the connection of the guests with the city and its special contrast of modern urbanism and historic landscapes in City's Art & Shopping hub Monastiraki.
neighborhood_overview: As one of the world’s oldest cities, there's no surprise at the sheer amount of things to do in Athens – the destination is a master of reinvention. Athens has morphed into southern Europe’s capital of cool. Long weekenders are swooping in to check out the exciting food scene and check into the new wave of cool hotels in Athens. Artists and designers are settling in for good, lured by affordable rents, the promise of sunshine, and an anarchic spirit where you don’t have to play by the rules. There’s nothing orderly about Athens: traffic is chaotic, life is messy, the architecture a mash-up of Byzantine and Bauhaus, neoclassical and nondescript. The Parthenon still dominates the skyline – and will forever be one of the key things to do in Athens – but for most Athenians the antiquities embedded among tightly packed apartment blocks are an afterthought. name: Athens Central Green
description:
This apartment is equipped with 2 bedrooms, a kitchen with an oven and a fridge, a flat-screen TV, a seating area and 1 bathroom equipped with a bath. Towels and bed linen are provided in the apartment. For added privacy, the accommodation features a private entrance.

Popular points of interest include Omonia Metro Station, National Archaeological Museum of Athens and Monastiraki Square. The nearest airport is Eleftherios Venizelos Airport, 30 km from Central Green Apartments.
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Athens! Athens is the capital of Greece and one of the most historic cities in the world. This city combines ancient and modern culture and offers a wealth of attractions for you to discover.

The Municipal Art Gallery of Athens is one of the leading cultural venues of the city. There you will find an impressive collection of works of art by artists from Greece and abroad. It is an ideal opportunity to discover the local art scene.

Avdi Square is a lively space in the center of Athens. Here you will find many cafes, restaurants and bars, where you can enjoy local food and drinks. The square also has a market, where you can buy local products and souvenirs.

From your accommodation, you will be within walking distance of these attractions and have easy access to other popular city attractions such as the Acropolis, the Acropolis Museum and the Plaka.

description: This stunning apartment in the heart of Thiseio boasts modern furnishings, a fully equipped kitchen, and luxurious amenities including air conditioning and a flat-screen TV. With an inviting atmosphere and a charming patio, it's the perfect base to explore Athens, with the best restaurants, cafes, and shops just steps away. neighborhood_overview:
In every nook and cranny of the Thissio-Petralona area, you're treated to breathtaking views of the Acropolis, making it a cherished spot for both Athenians and visitors. Nestled close to Plaka, you'll find yourself immersed in the heartbeat of the city, with easy access to countless ancient sites.
But it's not just history that draws people here—Thiseio & Petralona are alive with the vibrant energy of trendy cafes and bars, inviting you to savor every moment.
Prepare to be enchanted by one of Athens' most captivating locales. With Plaka nearby, you can stroll through time and discover ancient wonders, all while soaking in the lively atmosphere of its chic cafes and bars.

name: Sunny central Athenian penthouse
description: This penthouse apartment is perfect for hosting a family or a small group. The layout is efficient and offers secluded rooms with a wraparound balcony boasting an outdoor patio for taking in the vibrant city surroundings. The apartment is a block away from Ermou street, the shopping Mecca of Athens leading to ALL the international tourists sites a short stroll away. Countless cafes, restaurants bars and a major transportation hub, are all nearby.
neighborhood_overview:
Syntagma Square, also known as Constitution Square, is one of the most prominent and bustling public squares located in the heart of Athens, Greece. It holds significant historical, cultural, and political importance, making it a must-visit destination for tourists. Ermou street is on the parallel street to the apartment and offers major and local fashion brands, which leads to Monastiraki, the largest and most popular flea market in Athens.
Within walking distance from Syntagma Square, you can explore several cultural landmarks, including the historic Plaka neighborhood, the Acropolis with its iconic Parthenon, the Ancient Agora, and the Temple of Olympian Zeus.

name: Serene  apartment - 5 min walk to Acropolis museum
description:
This elegant and quiet apartment with a lot of natural light is perfect for a small family or two couples. Koukaki is one of the most popular neighborhoods in Athens due to its young and artsy demographic. The apartment is in close proximity to major tourist attractions like the Acropolis museum, the temple of Zeus and Plaka market.
Top rated cafes and restaurants of Athens are located within a surrounding two block radius.
neighborhood_overview:
Situated just south of the Acropolis, Koukaki has gained popularity in recent years as a trendy and lively area that offers a mix of modern amenities and historical charm.
The neighborhood is known for its picturesque streets, lined with small cafes, traditional taverns, and local shops. It has a unique atmosphere, combining the energy of a bustling urban area with a relaxed and friendly vibe. Koukaki has managed to maintain its authentic character, making it a favorite spot among locals and tourists alike.
One of the main attractions in Koukaki is its proximity to the Acropolis and other significant landmarks.

name: Beautiful loft in 20' walk from Acropolis
description:
Fully renovated luminous loft is just in 20 minutes’ walk from Acropolis & Acropolis Museum.
Located on the 7th floor, it has a spacious furnished terrace with the panoramic views to Philopappou Hill and Hymettos mountains.
The loft offers everything you need to enjoy a short-term or a long-term stays in Athens: fully equipped kitchen, big dining table which can be used also as a working deck, comfortable soft chairs, dishwasher, cloth washer & dryer, queen size bed with anatomic mattress
neighborhood_overview:
Considered as one of the safest and the coolest neighborhoods in Athens, Koukaki is a place that has it all.
From vibrant coffee places and bars to minimal restaurants and taverns, it offers a variety of choices.
Its stylish shops, the proximity to the Acropolis Museum and the local archeological sites, as well as the laid back vibe make it one of the best non-touristy neighborhoods in Athens.

When you find yourself strolling around its neighborhoods, you will discover both neoclassical and modern houses, as well as shops with strong local color.

A walk on Philopappou Hill is also highly recommended to see ancient monuments and find viewpoints that will allow you to enjoy the urban landscape from a distance.

The closest beach is Mpati beach, just in 7,7 km from the apartment. Kalamaki beach is in 9,7 km.

name: LIV - Contemporary Apartment in Athens
description:
Welcome to Our Stylish Apartment in Petralona!

Experience Athens like a local in our spacious and bright apartment, perfect for group trips! Whether you're a family, a group of friends, or a couple, you'll find comfort and elegance in our thoughtfully designed space.

The Space

2 Bedrooms & 1 Bathroom: Comfortable and cozy for a restful stay.
Large Kitchen & Dining Area: Perfect for cooking and enjoying meals together.
neighborhood_overview:
Petralona, nestled on the southwest side of Athens, Greece, is a vibrant and eclectic neighborhood with a rich history and a distinct character. Here's a detailed description of the area:

Historical Charm: Petralona is known for its historical charm, with narrow streets lined with neoclassical buildings, traditional tavernas, and cozy cafes. The neighborhood's roots date back to ancient times, with evidence of human settlement found in nearby caves, including the famous Petralona Cave, which boasts stalactites and stalagmites and is renowned for its archaeological significance.

Bohemian Vibe: Petralona has developed a bohemian atmosphere, attracting artists, musicians, and creative minds. Art galleries, workshops, and studios dot the neighborhood, contributing to its vibrant cultural scene. Visitors can explore local art exhibitions, attend live music performances, or simply soak up the artistic energy that permeates the streets.

Cosmopolitan Diversity:
host_about:
LIV Your Way! 

Experience Athens in our handpicked apartments, nestled in vibrant neighborhoods. Enjoy a five-star stay with our dedicated team, committed to your comfort. 

Consider our home yours—where guests are treated like lifelong friends. 

Excited to host you soon! 

The LIV Homes Team

name: Sun-Kissed Boho Haven with Whirlpool Bliss & Patio
description: Bohemian-chic renovated 65m2 two bedroom apartment located in the lively Neos Kosmos area. Newly renovated, soft, earthy color palettes, natural materials, and urban minimalism create a universe of unpretentious luxury & make it the perfect getaway.  Sleep on clouds on our two royal queen-size beds with fluffy pillows & linen. Immerse yourself in the luxury whirlpool tub in the spacious bathroom with walk in rain-shower. Air-conditioning, fast WIFI & smart-tv's in both rooms w/ free Netflix.
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in the select residential neighborhood of Neos Kosmos, our enchanting haven offers a safe and central location, placing all of Athens' wonders within your reach.

Immerse yourself in the historical allure just steps away. Cross the Acropolis ring road and venture into the exclusive managed entrances to Filopappou Hill. Traverse the abundant walking trails and uncover archaeological treasures along the way. Within a leisurely 15-minute stroll, you'll find yourself captivated by the grandeur of the Acropolis and the charm of Plaka, where ancient history intertwines with vibrant modernity.

Indulge in the thriving energy of the neighboring Koukaki area, an urban neighborhood beloved by locals and visitors alike. Delight in casual dining experiences, traditional tavernas, and lively bars. Explore the abundance of green groceries and markets, immersing yourself in the authentic flavors of Athens. Kerameikos was named in 2018 by Forbes one of the world’s coolest neighborhoods. It’s an exciting part of the city with endless choices of bars and restaurants, and it’s a place where you can feel the vibrancy of new Athens unite with the grandeur of the old.

The apartment is located within walking distance (10-20 minutes) to all the Main Archaeological Sites of Kerameikos, Monastiraki, Thissio, Plaka, Acropolis & Psirri. Kerameikos was named in 2018 by Forbes one of the world’s coolest neighborhoods. It’s an exciting part of the city with endless choices of bars and restaurants, and it’s a place where you can feel the vibrancy of new Athens unite with the grandeur of the old. It was one of the largest districts of ancient Athens located on the northwestern edge of the city. As its name suggests, it was a settlement area for potters and vase painters and the main place of production of the famous Attic vases. name: Prestigious apartment close to attractions!
description: 80m² apartment on the 1st floor in the Kerameikos area featuring two King bedrooms, one king-size sofa-bed in the living room, one full-size bathroom, a full kitchen and a balcony with a lovely view of the square. neighborhood_overview: Kerameikos has a storied history as an ancient potter’s settlement, and today, this edgy neighbourhood brims with the creative energy that informed its first inhabitants with ceramic studios, artist-run galleries,  and improv speakeasies behind grafitti-splashed facades.  The listing is walking distance from Psirri and the Acropolis.  There are nice restaurants, cafe bars, but unfortunately you may encounter some homeless on your way about town.  They pose you no threat, so no need to be concerned!

neighborhood_overview: As one of the world’s oldest cities, there's no surprise at the sheer amount of things to do in Athens – the destination is a master of reinvention. Athens has morphed into southern Europe’s capital of cool. Long weekenders are swooping in to check out the exciting food scene and check into the new wave of cool hotels in Athens. Artists and designers are settling in for good, lured by affordable rents, the promise of sunshine, and an anarchic spirit where you don’t have to play by the rules. There’s nothing orderly about Athens: traffic is chaotic, life is messy, the architecture a mash-up of Byzantine and Bauhaus, neoclassical and nondescript. The Parthenon still dominates the skyline – and will forever be one of the key things to do in Athens – but for most Athenians the antiquities embedded among tightly packed apartment blocks are an afterthought. It’s in the graffitied backstreets and café-lined squares, the factories converted into galleries, bars hidden in arcades, and secret co

name: Pearl in the heart of Athens
description:
Enjoy a stylish experience at this centrally-located place inside a small park . EASY ACCESS to public transport.
20 minutes from EDEM beach , 9 minutes from SYNTAGMA square (By tram). Walking : 1 min. to tram/ 2 min. to bus & trolley/ 5 minutes to metro stations. ACROPOLIS museum is 16 minutes walk .
Peaceful neighborhood, BAUHAUS style buildings amid several PARKS in a row. Supermarket, pharmacy, restaurants, police station in 2 minutes walking distance. Nearby contemporary Cultural Centers .
neighborhood_overview: Founded in 1914, this historical neighborhood hosted the first Armenian refugees and then in 1922 thousands of Greek refugees that fled Asia Minor . It consists of several buildings of BAUHAUS style, scattered between parks. Since 2000 when Athens METRO, and since 2004 when Athens TRAMWAY  have started operating the area shows increasing development potential; new markets restaurants, bars , live pubs, cultural centers and theaters are opening year by year. Nevertheless it still remains a quiet and safe area, close to major transport links and the center of the city .
host_about: Traveling is a way to meet new people and cultures , open up your mind and increase your tolerance, create compassion.

The vibrant neighbourhood of Pagrati is bustling with artisanal coffee shops, galleries, book shops, charming bars and gourmet restaurants at the cutting edge of Athens' bourgeoning gastro scene and Kolonaki's high end luxury boutiques and buzzy nightlife are right on your doorstep.

neighborhood_overview:
Discover the Charm of Monastiraki, Athens:

Nestled in the heart of Athens, Monastiraki blends ancient allure with modern energy, offering a treasure trove of experiences.

Ancient Marvels:
Explore Monastiraki's cobbled streets and iconic square, surrounded by the Ancient Agora and echoes of ancient Greek philosophers. Visit the Acropolis, a symbol of classical Greece, and the Museum of the Ancient Agora for a deeper dive into history.

Monuments and Museums:
Delve into the past at the Acropolis and marvel at the Parthenon's brilliance. Discover the Museum of the Ancient Agora's artifacts, bringing ancient Athenian life to light.

Lively Bazaars and Markets:
Indulge your senses in Monastiraki's bustling markets, where vibrant street art meets antique treasures in the Flea Market.

name: Acropolis Spa Loft
description: Imagine unwinding in your private ozon Jacuzzi next to a king size bed,soaking in breathtaking views of the Acropolis and the mesmerizing cityscape of Athens.This unique nocarz seamlessly connects the living, dining, and kitchen areas, providing a perfect space for relaxation. neighborhood_overview:
Kerameikos, located in Athens, Greece, is an ancient and historic neighborhood with a rich cultural and archaeological significance. Named after the ancient cemetery that once occupied the area, Kerameikos offers a captivating blend of ancient ruins, modern attractions, and a vibrant local atmosphere.

One of the major highlights of Kerameikos is its archaeological site, which holds great historical importance. Visitors can explore the well-preserved remnants of tombs, burial mounds, and the ancient city walls, providing a fascinating glimpse into Athens' past.

Adjacent to the archaeological site is the Kerameikos Museum, which houses a vast collection of ancient artifacts discovered in the area. The museum offers a comprehensive overview of the burial customs, artwork, and daily life of the ancient Athenians. Visitors can admire intricate pottery, sculptures, and other archaeological finds that provide insight into the city's rich history.

name: Superior Suite with view at Acropolis and terrace
description: A Luxurious superior suite right in the heart of historical centre, with a unique view of Acropolis Hill and with a big  terrace. Only a few steps away from the archeological area and museum of Acropolis and metro station.
host_about:
Hello!!! Step One Luxury Suites are located in the shade of the rock of Acropolis, in "Plaka", the ancient part of Athens city centre, right next to the Museum and the archaeological sites of the Acropolis.
The Suites are housed in a neoclassical building of 1836, on the basement of which, the world-renowned painter "Takis Moraitis" continues to paint next to an ancient 2000-year-old jar.
Our unit consists of 3 separate rooms, with Greek breakfast and free wifi. Our special feature is the dome on the ceiling of our room "Aerides".
On the ground floor of the building you can taste homade Greek donuts, traditional sweets and ice cream from "Peters" shop.
From our unit, you have quick and easy access to "Parthenonas", the Columns of the Olympian Zeus, the "Erechtheion", the Roman Market, the Panathenaic Stadium and Syntagma Square.

name: Athens Penthouse
description: Experience Kolonaki luxury in our 2-floor, 260 m2 penthouse. Modern interiors, high-end amenities, and a rooftop with Acropolis views. Located in aristocratic Kolonaki, it's a prestigious haven. 3 bedrooms, 2 ensuite bathrooms on the first level, master bedroom on the second. Balconies on both floors offer panoramic Athens views. Elevate your stay in this exclusive penthouse where luxury meets Kolonaki's historic charm.
neighborhood_overview:
Kolonaki, the central and most prestigious neighborhood in Athens, is a symbol of elegance and sophistication. With its upscale boutiques, fashionable cafes, and luxurious residences, Kolonaki attracts a discerning crowd seeking a refined urban experience. Its charming streets are lined with neoclassical buildings, while its central location offers easy access to cultural landmarks, upscale shopping districts, and vibrant nightlife.

Moreover, Kolonaki is a cultural haven with numerous museums, including those in close proximity to the Acropolis, such as the Acropolis Museum. The neighborhood's rich tapestry includes historical sites like Monastiraki, creating an immersive experience for those who appreciate Athens' cultural heritage. Kolonaki truly embodies the essence of modern luxury, seamlessly blending contemporary sophistication with the city's cultural treasures.
host_about: We're an international team, a mosaic of individuals from various countries with their unique traditions and ways of life. Our journey spans across Germany, Russia, Australia, Greece, Abu Dhabi, and more. These experiences have cultivated a profound understanding and appreciation for diverse cultures, enriching our approach to a globalized world. With decades in the tourism industry, we've mastered the true essence of hospitality.

name: Caesaria Spacious 3bd
description: Just minutes from the bustling of Mavili Square is this beautiful three-bedroom, two-bathrooms and a wc apartment in the heart of Athens.  Step outside onto the street, and you are just moments from a lively array of bars, restaurants, and boutique shops.  If you have been searching for the perfect retreat that lets you experience the delights of this historic city with ease, then this bright and airy apartment is just what you need.
neighborhood_overview:
Whether you are in Athens for business or pleasure, it can be fun to venture off the most popular nightlife trails Syntagma – Monastiraki - Psyrri, or Gazi – Kerameikos - Metaxourgeio to Mavili Square, west of Ambelokipi. Lined with bars and a handful of stores, it’s known for its landmark fountain overlooking Vas. Sophias and its deliciously sinful ‘vromiko’ hot dog van (now a van in a wall, called Kantina Mavili).

There is so much to see in Athens that one visit is never enough. In fact, you could spend a lifetime in this magical place and never get to see all of it. From the fabulous art and cultural attractions to the mighty symbols of the Greek Empire, it's a tapestry of wonders. This is where fine dining has its roots, so expect the best in traditional Greek cuisine combined with new and experimental fusions that take you on a culinary journey around the world.

neighborhood_overview: Plaka is the oldest district in Athens, built at the foothill of the Acropolis, with picturesque neoclassical houses and mainly pedestrian streets. Walking uphill through the Anafiotika area, you can enjoy a wonderful  view, and many cafes offer a pleasant occasion to rest and cool off. Local food at the many tavernas, in cool gardens or courtyards, shopping for artifacts and souvenirs, visiting the archeological sites like the Tower of Winds or the Lysikrates Monument, make a stroll through this historical neighborhood an interesting and attractive experience. Distances are short, so one morning or afternoon gives you enough time to see almost everything.

neighborhood_overview:
Right in the heart of the commercial triangle of Athens which is - as denoted by its name – the market place of Athens and not only as the Metropolis of Athens is within 2-minute walking from the apartment. The “vertices” of the triangle are the three main squares of the city: Omonoia, Syntagma and Monastiraki.
The commercial triangle was used by the old Athenians for their daily shopping of all goods. Varvakeios, the meat market, the fish market and the popular Ermou street- which is the main commercial road of Athens are located here. What everyone finds specifically interesting is that the area is mainly organized the old way: each street is “themed” for specific goods: in Vyssis str. you will find stores that sell doorknobs of every kind, in Praxitelous str. shops with lamps, in Karageorgi Servias shops with fabrics and in Agiou Markou shops with low budget clothes and shoes.

name: Elliot's Duplex with Terrace
description: Elliot is cool and free minded so he designed all amenities and services with your independence and comfort in mind. He may be elusive, but his presence is felt in every corner of the building, ensuring that your stay is perfectly orchestrated and effortlessly smooth. Operating discreetly behind the scenes, he takes care of all the intricate details so you can focus on enjoying your time in the city. Although a free spirit, rest assured he has thought everything through.
neighborhood_overview:
Elliot lives and breathes in the heart of Exarchia, one of Athens’ most vibrant neighbourhoods. This eclectic and bohemian district is known for its rich history, artistic atmosphere, and rebellious spirit, just like Elliot. Exarchia is a refuge for creative souls and art enthusiasts. As you wander through the graffiti-covered streets, you’ll notice the vibrant murals and thought-provoking displays of artistic expression. Tap into its bohemian energy by exploring independent bookstores, alternative music venues, and vibrant cafes where locals gather to discuss art, politics, and philosophy.

Exarchia is set into the western slope of Lycabettus Hill and is bordered on the east by Kolonaki neighborhood. Just a breath away from Syntagma square and all the central districts of Athens, is the perfect base for exploring the city.
host_about: Elliot is different. He is friendly, elegant, and he changes; like us. He is always here to take care of us, keep us company, protect us, be our friend. Most of all, Elliot is your host.

host_about:
A very warm welcome from me, Theoharis, the owner of Vilaman ΙΚΕ, the property management company that is running this property.
Having traveled extensively in the Americas, SE Asia and Europe, and being a demanding traveller myself, I adapted my experiences to my native Greece and combined them with our philoxenia: the ancient greek word that literally means a “friend to a stranger” and is synonymous to hospitality. 
For Greeks however, it is something deeper than that., it is an unspoken cultural law that shows generosity and courtesy to strangers. 
In addition, my personal relationship with each property owner allows me to make sure that everything runs smoothly, as desired, so that our every guest feels at home at our properties and takes a unique experience and unforgettable memories back home with them.

neighborhood_overview:
Despite the large numbers of transients Exarchia attracts, this jumble of pre-war townhouses and ageing post-war apartment buildings preserves a strong sense of community and tradition, with publishing houses, bookbinders, the city’s liveliest farmers’ market, rembetiko tavernas, punk boutiques, old-fashioned coffee houses, bars, a self-managed park, the "National Archaeological Museum" and delightful "Epigraphic Museum", all within its boundaries.
Built into the slopes of Lycabettus Hill, Neapoli, the city’s second oldest neighbourhood after Plaka, acts as a buffer zone between Kolonaki, disdained by Exarchia’s denizens as the bastion of the bourgeoisie.

name: Penelope’s Charming 2-Bedroom Apartment in Athens
description: Discover Penelope, a delightful 2-bedroom apartment nestled in the heart of Athens on Stravonos 8 Street. Located in a vibrant part of the city, you'll have easy access to Athens' rich cultural heritage, nearby amenities, and the warmth of Greek hospitality. Whether you're here for leisure or business, Penelope apartment promises a memorable and convenient stay.
neighborhood_overview:
Athens is a city steeped in history and culture, offering a wealth of things to do and explore.

1. Acropolis and Parthenon: Explore the iconic Acropolis, a UNESCO World Heritage site, and visit the magnificent Parthenon, a symbol of ancient Greek civilization. Nearby amenities may include guided tours, souvenir shops, and cafes.

2. Plaka Neighborhood: Stroll through the charming Plaka district, known for its picturesque streets, quaint shops, and traditional Greek restaurants. You'll find numerous dining options and boutique stores nearby.

3. National Archaeological Museum: Discover Greece's rich history at the National Archaeological Museum, which houses an extensive collection of ancient artifacts. Nearby, you can find cafes and shops for a leisurely break.

4. Monastiraki Flea Market: Hunt for treasures and souvenirs at the bustling Monastiraki Flea Market. Nearby amenities include street food vendors, antique shops, and more.

name: Beautifully curated Renov 1br in Keramikos
description:
Welcome to your sanctuary in the heart of Athens, a renovated 1 Br apartment nestled in the vibrant Kerameikos neighborhood. An excellent value for money choice for your stay! Step into a cocoon of serenity, where every corner is a white cloud of comfort, coziness, and pure pleasure.
Our meticulous attention to detail ensures that everything is soothing to the eye.
host_about:
A very warm welcome from me, Theoharis, the owner of Vilaman ΙΚΕ, the property management company that is running this property.
Having traveled extensively in the Americas, SE Asia and Europe, and being a demanding traveller myself, I adapted my experiences to my native Greece and combined them with our philoxenia: the ancient greek word that literally means a “friend to a stranger” and is synonymous to hospitality. 
For Greeks however, it is something deeper than that., it is an unspoken cultural law that shows generosity and courtesy to strangers. 
In addition, my personal relationship with each property owner allows me to make sure that everything runs smoothly, as desired, so that our every guest feels at home at our properties and takes a unique experience and unforgettable memories back home with them.

neighborhood_overview:
Pagrati is an excellent area to live in, or to stay as a visitor in Athens. It combines the "new" with the "old" in the best way. It is no coincidence that it is often distinguished as the world's coolest neighborhood.

name: High-end Renov Apt with an über office space
description:
Welcome to our high-end apartment, strategically located to elevate your stay to a new level of comfort and sophistication. Immerse yourself in the epitome of quality interior design and aesthetics, where every detail has been meticulously crafted to ensure your day and night are nothing short of perfect.
As you step inside, you'll immediately sense the dedication to craftsmanship, with luxurious furniture and high-quality materials that have been chosen with your pleasure in mind.
host_about:
A very warm welcome from me, Theoharis, the owner of Vilaman ΙΚΕ, the property management company that is running this property.
Having traveled extensively in the Americas, SE Asia and Europe, and being a demanding traveller myself, I adapted my experiences to my native Greece and combined them with our philoxenia: the ancient greek word that literally means a “friend to a stranger” and is synonymous to hospitality. 
For Greeks however, it is something deeper than that., it is an unspoken cultural law that shows generosity and courtesy to strangers. 
In addition, my personal relationship with each property owner allows me to make sure that everything runs smoothly, as desired, so that our every guest feels at home at our properties and takes a unique experience and unforgettable memories back home with them.

name: Katerina's house - Hilton area
description:
It is a classic Athenian apartment in one of the most beautiful, quiet and safe neighborhoods of downtown Athens, in a fully serviced neighborhood in every area.
Located very close to hotels (Hilton – Caravel). The Metro stations (“Evangelismos” - “Concert Hall”) are at most ten minutes away, while within walking distance there are bus stops in every direction, central boulevards, (V. Alexandrou, V. Sofias) super market, kiosks, cafes, and farmers market
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the Hilton area, between the stations: Annunciation and Concert Hall, 6'walk from the National Gallery (400m). Very close also are the Byzantine - Christian Museum, the Museum of Cycladic Art, the Benaki Museum of Greek Culture, etc.
Also walking, you can reach the Monument of the World, the Acropolis, in less than 30', the ancient Kallimarmaro, the Panathenaic Stadium in 18' and the Acropolis Museum at 35', or use the Metro (SI. Evangelismos), there are 2 stops for St. Acropolis.
For a walk, you can visit the Japanese Park of Athens ( 5'), the Ilision Grove (4') and, a little further away, the historic National Garden ( 20') and the garden of the Zappeion Megaron (24').
At a distance of 4'to 15' you will find some of the best restaurants in Athens: some with a long history such as “Enchanted Avlos” or Michelin stars like Cookoovaya or Vezené Athens or other beautiful options like Agora Select, Vlassis, or 5F with traditional Greek cuisine

The district of Petralona is peaceful, it has a real neighbothood life with a lot of local shops, couple of local gyro shops, bakeries, restaurants and many attraction nearby. It is conocidered today as the favorite district of the Athenians which attracts many visitors.
The property is located on a quiet street, 2 minute walk away from Petralona metro station and within a 20-minute walk / 9- minute cycling to the heart of Athens and all the famous sights.
Every Wednesday at Pandorou street, two blocks down from the property, farmers gather and sell their fruits and vegetables in a street market. Should you be visiting on a Wednesday make sure not to miss it! A laundromat is also conveniently located about 2 minutes walking distance away!
Cross the metro station to the other side and you will find yourself at the Upper Petralona, right under the Filoppapou hill. Many options for food as well as drinks from Thai restaurants to cocktail bars.
Upon reaching the Metro

Nestled in the heart of Athens, Koukaki is a vibrant and charming neighborhood that effortlessly blends tradition with modernity. This area, situated just a stone's throw away from the iconic Acropolis, boasts a unique atmosphere that captivates locals and visitors alike.

Koukaki is renowned for its authentic Greek character, with narrow streets lined by neoclassical buildings, creating a picturesque setting for leisurely strolls. The neighborhood is dotted with cozy cafes, traditional tavernas, and family-run shops, offering a taste of authentic Greek hospitality.

One of Koukaki's undeniable highlights is its proximity to the Acropolis and the Acropolis Museum. This historical backdrop not only provides a sense of awe but also lends a unique identity to the area. Visitors can explore ancient ruins and archaeological sites while enjoying breathtaking views of the city.

SPECIAL OFFERS FOR EARLY 2025!

We are honored to introduce our latest apartment (Dec.2023), especially designed to offer comfort and accessibility, so much needed in Athenian short-term rentals, for both leisure and business trips.

The Gracious apartment is the fourth large apartment at the A.U.R.A. complex, a privately owned and managed property building, in the most convenient, quiet and beautiful Athenian neighborhood named Thission, in the heart of the Athenian historical center.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment's location is probably the best in Athens.

The neighborhood is Thission, a residential area, the most appealing of all for visitors as much as for Athenians, in the heart of the historic centre.

It combines the characteristics of the mid-19th century through the neoclassical residencies (which are being continuously renovated) with the proximity to the most important archaeological sites through pedestrian streets and some of the most beautiful walks in any European capital.

It also offers several ultra-hip surrounding areas to eat, shop and walk around.

A large choice of cafes, traditional taverns, and restaurants as well as local craft or fashion shops, offer visitors the option to spend time in the neighborhood if they please to acquire the inside knowledge of Athens!

The A.U.R.A. Gracious Apartment is a 10-15 minutes’ walk to the most important attractions but outside the touristy mass or city noise so even my

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in Pagrati, a breath away from the historical center of Athens. Pagrati is a preeminent urban neighborhood of Athens where many personalities of modern Greece lived, grew up and created, such as the Nobel Prize-winning poet Georgios Seferis, the composers Thanos Mikroutsikos and Eleni Karaindrou, the director Nikos Koundouros, the painter Alekos Fasianos, the former President of of the Hellenic Republic Karolos Papoulias and many others. The personalities most connected to the area, however, are the composer Manos Hadjidakis, who lived in Pagrati for the longest and most creative part of his life, and the conductor, composer and professor at Boston University Theodore Antoniou. Pagrati is a safe area, full of beautiful restaurants, cafes, shops and pedestrian streets that one would love to walk and explore.
A breath away from the apartment are the Evangelismos Metro Station (500 m.), Panathenaic Stadium, the National Garden and the Zappeion Garden, the Nat

host_about:
Hello, we are two brothers in our 30s, Yannis and Taxiarhis (Tax)! 

We grew up in Athens before spending our 20s in the UK and France studying & working (and doing lots of travelling along the way!). Our favorite destinations include the US, Thailand, India and Spain.

Our stays on great nocarz's around the world inspired us to get involved with hospitality in 2015, and by 2017 we quit our careers in Finance to focus exclusively on providing great stays in the city we love, Athens.

All our apartments are designed & renovated by our team of architects in order to offer comfortable stays at the most desirable Athens locations.

You can expect quick and friendly communication, a clean and tidy space, and above all reliability. We are happy to offer assistance and tips before and during your stay.

name: Acropolis View & Spa Penthouse apartment
description:
Romantic Athenian Eagle's Nest Overlooking the majestic Acropolis
Nestled in the heart of Athens, our top-floor studio in Neos Kosmos offers more than just a stay; it's an experience that encapsulates the romantic essence of ancient and modern Greece. Whether you're a local seeking a serene escape or a traveler eager to immerse yourself in the city's rich tapestry, this intimate retreat promises memories to last a lifetime.
neighborhood_overview:
Parking is free on the streets around the property but a bit difficult to find a spot since it is at the center of Athens. There are two private parking spots though which garages, pretty convenient and very close to the property.

Nestled in the select residential neighborhood of Neos Kosmos, our enchanting haven offers a safe and central location, placing all of Athens' wonders within your reach.

Immerse yourself in the historical allure just steps away. Cross the Acropolis ring road and venture into the exclusive managed entrances to Filopappou Hill. Traverse the abundant walking trails and uncover archaeological treasures along the way. Within a leisurely 15-minute stroll, you'll find yourself captivated by the grandeur of the Acropolis and the charm of Plaka, where ancient history intertwines with vibrant modernity.

Indulge in the thriving energy of the neighboring Koukaki area, an urban neighborhood beloved by locals and visitors alike. Delight in

name: Archetypon's Athens Boutique Suite
description:
Enjoy a unique stay experience in the most alternative neighborhood of Athens, in Exarchia, in the hospitality space curated based on comfort, art and design by Olive Groves Archetypon, responsible for producing one of the world's best olive oils, Archetypon Premium Extra Virgin Olive Oil (EVOOWR2022).
Archetypon Athens Boutique Suite welcomes you to Greece, in the place of olive and olive oil!
neighborhood_overview:
In the center of the city, in Exarchia, in the most bohemian and alternative neighborhood of Athens, this fully and luxuriously renovated apartment by the architect and founder of Olive Groves Archetypon, will be the perfect base for your excursions, but also a unique retreat in the heart of the bustling city. Just a 5-minute walk from the National Archaeological Museum, the Polytechnic, Exarchia Square and the metro of Omonia Square, 15 minutes from the park of Pedio Areos, 20 minutes from the Lycabettus Hill, with the incredible view of the Acropolis, the Parthenon and all the Attica Basin, from the National Garden and the Plaka area.
Exarcheia is known for its alternative, independent and multifaceted character. Here you will find from traditional cafes, galleys and taverns to award-winning restaurants, street food, bars, music scenes, concert venues, summer cinemas, bookstores, handicrafts, organic products and the most famous outdoor farmers market of the city on Kallidromio

description: Discover an unparalleled Athens experience in this exceptional 3-bedroom, 165sq.m apartment nestled in the heart of Plaka. neighborhood_overview:
Discover the enchanting neighborhood of Plaka, a historic district in Athens, Greece, known for its allure and popularity among tourists. Immerse yourself in its labyrinthine streets, surrounded by numerous archaeological sites and vibrant neighborhoods that seamlessly blend modernity with the area's authentic charm.

Our nocarz is strategically located, offering easy access to various attractions within walking distance:

- Thiseion: 10 minutes walk
- Keramikos: 15 minutes walk
- Monastiraki (the ancient part of the city): 7 minutes walk
- Roman Agora: 6 minutes walk
- Acropolis Museum: 7 minutes walk
- Athens War Museum: 20 minutes walk
- Byzantine Museum: 20 minutes walk
- National Gallery: 27 minutes walk
- National Gardens: 12 minutes walk
- Benaki Museum: 15 minutes walk
- Temple of Olympian Zeus: 550 meters
- Modern Art Museum: 19 minutes walk
- Athens Segway Tours “Hop on - Hop Off Bus” (9, Aischino

name: Aionion Residences by K&K - Dione Residence
description:
Dione Residence is an apartment on the ground floor of the building, facing Vassilis street. There are 2 bedrooms with two en suite bathrooms (with shower) and a living area with a sofa that can be set as bed, a dining table and a kitchenette.
We welcome you to unwind in this unique home after a day of exploration in Athens.
neighborhood_overview:
The building lies in Vassilis street. Vassili was a nymph of the earth in Greek mythology whowas worshipped in Ilissos river. Twelve apartments received their names from mythical nymphs, except for the Apollo Luxury Residence. The Greek god of light had fallen in love with the nymph Daphne and we named the two interjoined rooms after them.
The area is a perfect blend of two worlds.
One side is a quiet authentic neighborhood with traditional little stores that will make you feel you live like a local.
The other side is steps away from the famous Apostolou Pavlou pedestrian street, the most beautiful street to walk in the whole city.
It is said that all the history of Athens lies at the sides of this road, which takes you to the Acropolis in just a 10 minute walk.

name: Deluxe Apartment in Athens, 10 mins walk to Metro
description: Ideally situated off-centre, this two-bedroom apartment offers convenient access to all sights and attractions. Enjoy the added luxury of a private balcony, a fully equipped kitchen, and a spacious living and dining area featuring a generous couch.
